0521727532 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = singh | first = sujala | title = terror and the postcolonial : a concise companion | year = 2009 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405191548 | editor = elleke boehmer , stephen morton | quote = one of the most horrific instances of fascistic state terror took place in gujarat in 2002 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = tilly | first = charles | title = regimes and repertoires | year = 2006 | publisher = university of chicago press | isbn = 978 - 0226803500 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = tambiah | first = stanely j . | title = leveling crowds : ethnonationalist conflicts and collective violence in south asia | year = 1997 | publisher = university of california press | isbn = 978 - 0520206427 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite news | last = times of india | first = tnn | title = state pogroms glossed over | newspaper = the times of india | date = 31 december 2005 | ref = {{ sfnref | times of india | 2005 }} }} * {{ cite news | last = varia | first = toral | title = mumbai riots a planned , perfected pogrom ? | newspaper = cnn - ibn | date = 2 september 2007 | ref = {{ sfnref | varia | 2007 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = ethnic conflict and civic life : hindus and muslims in india | year = 2003 | publisher = yale university press | isbn = 978 - 0300100136 | page = 8 | edition = 2nd revised | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = vickery | first = jacqueline | title = encyclopedia of social movement media | date = 30 december 2010 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0761926887 | editor = john d . h . downing | ref = harv }} * {{ cite web | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = understanding gujarat violence | url = http : / / conconflicts . ssrc . org / archives / gujarat / varshney / | publisher = social science research council | ref = {{ sfnref | varshney }} }} * {{ cite book | last = weigl | first = constanze | title = reproductive health behaviour and decision - making of muslim women : an ethnographic study in a low - income community in urban north india | year = 2012 | publisher = lit verlag | isbn = 978 - 3643107701 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = wilkinson | first = steven i . | title = votes and violence : electoral competition and ethnic riots in india | year = 2006 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521536059 | ref = harv }} {{ refend }} {{ discrimination }} {{ reflist }} [[ category : pogroms ]] [[ category : anti - muslim pogroms in india ]]
172 {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 121 }} anti - muslim violence creates a security risk for hindus residing outside of india . since the 1950s , there have been retaliatory attacks on hindus in pakistan and [[ bangladesh ]] in response to anti - muslim violence , after the 1992 violence hindu temples were attacked in [[ great britain | britain ]] , [[ dubai ]] and [[ thailand ]] . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 16 }} this recurring violence has become a rigidly conventional pattern which has created a divide between the muslim and hindu communities . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 187 }} [[ jamaat - e - islami hind ]] has spoken out against these communal clashes , as it believes that the violence not only impacts upon muslims , but on india as a whole , and that these riots are damaging to progress . {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 86 }} in gujarat , the [[ terrorist and disruptive activities ( prevention ) act ]] ( tada ) was used in incidents pertaining to communal violence in 1992 and 1993 . the majority of those arrested under the act were muslim . conversely , tada was not used after the violence carried out against muslims during the [[ bombay riots ]] . {{ sfn | singh | 2012 | p = 427 }} = = = demographics = = = the bjp , as well as other politicians , argue that [[ demographics ]] play an essential role in indian elections . the bjp believe that the higher the number of muslims within a constituency , the higher are the chances of parties from the center to agree with minority groups ' requests , which lowers the chances of muslims " building bridges " with their hindu neighbors . as such , according to this argument " muslim appeasement " is the root cause of communal violence . {{ sfn | varshney | 2003 | p = 8 }} susanne and lloyd rudolph argue that economic disparity is a reason for the aggression shown towards muslims by hindus . as india ' s economy expanded due to [[ globalization ]] and [[ investment ]] from overseas companies , the expectations of the hindu population were not matched by opportunities . hindu nationalists then encouraged this perception , which leads the hindus to view muslims as the source of their troubles . {{ sfn | price | 2012 | p = 95 }} the actions of anti - hindu and anti - india militant groups in [[ kashmir conflict | kashmir ]] and pakistan have reinforced anti - muslim feelings in india , which has strengthened the hindu right ( hindutva ) . the hindutva discourse portrays muslims as traitors and state enemies , whose patriotism is suspected . {{ sfn | sikand | 2006 | p = 88 }} [[ sumit ganguly ]] argues that the rise in terrorism cannot only be attributed to [[ socioeconomics | socioeconomic ]] factors , but also to the violence perpetrated by hindutva forces . {{ sfn | ganguly | 2003 | p = 10 }} = = major incidents = = in october 1946 , in bihar , between 7 , 000 and 8 , 000 people were killed in an anti - muslim riot . the hindu chief minister refused to allow british troops to fire on the rioters . no enquiry was held , and he ignored the complicity of members of the [[ indian national congress | congress ]] party who took part in the violence . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 10 }} {{ sfn | bihar }} {{ sfn | markovits }} this rioting was in retaliation to the [[ noakhali carnage ]] against hindus which , in turn , was a reaction against the atrocities of [[ direct action day ]] in [[ kolkata | calcutta ]] . {{ sfn | d ' costa | 2010 | p = 213 }} = = = 1983 nellie massacre = = = in
256 newspaper = los angeles times | date = 25 february 2007 | ref = {{ sfnref | chu | 2007 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = chatterji | first = joya | title = the bangladesh reader : history , culture , politics | year = 2013 | publisher = duke university press | isbn = 978 - 0822353188 | editor = meghna guhathakurta , willem van schende | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = chandavarkar | first = rajnayaran | title = history , culture and the indian city | date = 3 september 2009 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521768719 | edition = 1st | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = chandavarkar | first = rajnayaran | title = history , culture and the indian city | date = 3 september 2009 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521768719 | edition = 1st | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = cohen | first = stephen p . | title = shooting for a century : the india - pakistan conundrum | year = 2013 | publisher = brookings institution press | isbn = 978 - 0815721864 | page = 66 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = datta | first = antara | title = refugees and borders in south asia : the great exodus of 1971 | year = 2012 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415524728 | page = 183 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = d ' costa | first = bina | title = nationbuilding , gender and war crimes in south asia | year = 2010 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415565660 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite journal | last = dhattiwala | first = raheel | coauthors = michael biggs | title = the political logic of ethnic violence the anti - muslim pogrom in gujarat , 2002 | journal = politics & society | date = december 2012 | volume = 40 | issue = 4 | doi = 10 . 1177 / 0032329212461125 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite journal | last = dhattiwala | first = raheel | coauthors = michael biggs | title = the political logic of ethnic violence : the anti - muslim pogrom in gujarat , 2002 | journal = politics & society | year = 2012 | volume = 40 | issue = 4 | doi = 10 . 1177 / 0032329212461125 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = eckhert | first = julia | title = the cultural lives of capital punishment : comparative perspectives | date = 25 may 2005 | publisher = stanford university press | isbn = 978 - 0804752343 | editor = austin sarat , christian boulanger | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = engineer | first = asghar ali | title = communal riots in post - independence india | year = 1991 | publisher = sangam | isbn = 978 - 0863111396 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite journal | last = engineer | first = asghar ali | title = gujarat riots in the light of the history of communal violence . | journal = economic and political weekly | date = december 2002 | volume = 37 | issue = 50 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = etzion | first = amitai | title = security first : for a muscular , moral foreign policy | year = 2008 | publisher = yale university press | isbn = 978 - 0300143072 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = ghosh | first = partha s . | title = peace studies : an introduction to the concept , scope , and themes | year = 2004 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0761996606 | editor = ranabir samaddar | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = gupta | first = ravi | title = routledge handbook of indian cinemas | chapter = the changing landscape | year = 2013 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415677745 | editor = k . moti gokulsing , wimal dissanayake | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = gangoli | first = geetanjali | title = indian feminisms : law , patriarchies and violence in india | date = 28 january 2007 | publisher = ashgate | isbn = 978 - 0754646044 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = ghassem - fachandi | first = parvis | title = pogrom in gujarat : hindu nationalism and anti - muslim violence in india | date = 19 march 2012 | publisher = princeton university press | isbn = 978 - 0691151779 | page = 2 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = ganguly | first = rajat | title = the state of india ' s democracy | chapter = democracy and ethnic conflict | year = 2007 | publisher = the johns hopkins university press | isbn = 978 - 0801887918 | editor = sumit ganguly , larry diamond , marc f . plattner | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = ganguly | first = sumit | title = the kashmir question : retrospect and prospect | year = 2003 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0714684390 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite web | last = human rights watch | first = h r . | title = compounding injustice : the government ' s failure to redress massacres in gujarat | year = 2003 | publisher = fédération internationale des droits de l ' homme | page = 57 | url = http : / / www . hrw . org / reports / 2003 / 06 / 30 / compounding - injustice | ref = {{ sfnref | human rights watch | 2003 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = hefner | first = robert w . | title = schooling islam : the culture and politics of modern muslim education | year = 2006 | publisher = princeton university press | isbn = 978 - 0691129334 | editor = robert w . hefner , muhammad qasim zaman | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = holt | first = peter m . | title = the cambridge history of islam | year = 1977 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521291378 | edition = new edition | editor = peter malcolm holt , ann k . s . lambton , bernard lewis | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = herman | first = phyllis k . | title = muslim cultures today : a reference guide | year = 2006 | publisher = greenwood | isbn = 978 - 0313323867 | editor = kathryn m . coughlin | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = hussain | first = monirul | title = the fleeing people of south asia : selections from refugee watch | date = 1 february 2009 | publisher = anthem | isbn = 978 - 8190583572 | page = 261 | editor = sibaji pratim basu | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = holst | first = arthur | title = encyclopedia of rape | date = 30 august 2004 | publisher = greenwood | isbn = 978 - 0313326875 | editor = merril d . smith | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = jaffrelot | first = christophe | title = religion , caste , and politics in india | year = 2011 | publisher = c hurst & co | isbn = 978 - 1849041386 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = jaffrelot | first = christophe | title = the hindu nationalist movement and indian politics 1925 - 1990s : strategies of identity - building , implantation and mobilisation | year = 1996 | publisher = c hurst & co | isbn = 9781850653011 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite news | last = krishnan | first = murali | title = modi ' s clearance in the gujarat riots case angers indian muslims | url = http : / / www . dw . de / modis - clearance - in - the - gujarat - riots - case - angers - indian - muslims / a - 15874606 |
687629462 0 = 2002 gujarat violence = = = {{ main | 2002 gujarat violence }} since partition , muslim community has been subject to mass violence in [[ gujarat ]] . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} in [[ 2002 gujarat violence | 2002 ]] , in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror , " {{ sfn | singh | 2009 | p = 248 }} hindu [[ extremism | extremists ]] carried out acts of violence against the muslim minority population . the starting point for the incident was the [[ godhra train burning ]] which was allegedly done by muslims . {{ sfn | tilly | 2006 | p = 119 }} during the incident , young girls were [[ rape in india | sexually assaulted ]] , burned or hacked to death . {{ sfn | holst | 2004 | p = 149 }} these rapes were condoned by the ruling bjp , {{ sfn | raman | 2009 | p = 210 }} {{ sfn | gangoli | 2007 | p = 42 }} whose refusal to intervene lead to the displacement of 200 , 000 . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 70 }} death toll figures range from the official estimate of 790 muslims and 254 hindus killed , to 2 , 000 muslims killed . {{ sfn | campbell | 2012 | p = 233 }} then chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215 }} according to brass , the only conclusion from the evidence which is available points to a methodical pogrom , which was carried out with " exceptional brutality and was highly coordinated " . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 388 }} in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a " state - sanctioned pogrom " . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }}
739713400 0 = = manifestation = = violence against muslims is frequently in the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segments of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs from one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the male members and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive including the children . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims . }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 | ps = : " violence perpetrated against muslims is now naturalized : riots are ' well - known and accepted transgression of routine political behavior in india . ' . . . ' hindu - muslim riots and anti - muslim pogroms have been endemic in india since independence . ' " }} these attacks are referred to as [[ communal violence | communal riots ]] in india and are seen to be part of a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the majority hindu and minority muslim communities , and have also been connected to a rise in [[ islamophobia ]] throughout the 20th century . {{ sfn | herman | 2006 | p = 65 }} most incidents have occurred in the northern and western states of india , whereas communalist sentiment in the south and east is less pronounced . {{ sfn | cohen | 2013 | p = 66 }} among the largest incidents were [[ great calcutta killings ]] in 1946 , [[ noakhali riots # repercussions in bihar | bihar ]] and garmukhteshwar in 1946 after [[ noakhali riot ]] in east bengal , the massacre of muslims in [[ jammu division | jammu ]] in 1947 , large - scale killing of muslims following the [[ operation polo ]] in [[ hyderabad state | hyderabad ]] , anti - muslim riots in kolkata in the aftermath of [[ 1950 barisal riots ]] and [[ 1964 east - pakistan riots ]] , [[ 1969 gujarat riots ]] , [[ 1984 bhiwandi riot ]] , [[ 1985 gujarat riots ]] , [[ 1989 bhagalpur riots ]] , [[ bombay riots ]] , [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] in 1983 {{ sfn | ganguly | 2007 | p = 135 }} and [[ 2002 gujarat violence | gujarat riot ]] in 2002 and [[ 2013 muzaffarnagar riots ]] . these patterns of violence have been well - established since partition , with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . {{ sfn | pennington | 2012 | p = 32 }} over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 60 }} in 1989 , there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} [[ praveen swami ]] believes these periodic acts of violence have " scarred india ' s post independence history " and have also hindered india ' s cause in [[ jammu and kashmir ]] with regard to the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . {{ sfn | swami | 2006 | p = 217 }}
750039165 0 = = manifestation = = violence against muslims is frequently in the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segments of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs from one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the male members and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive including the children . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims . }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 | ps = : " violence perpetrated against muslims is now naturalized : riots are ' well - known and accepted transgression of routine political behavior in india . ' . . . ' hindu - muslim riots and anti - muslim pogroms have been endemic in india since independence . ' " }} these attacks are referred to as [[ communal violence | communal riots ]] in india and are seen to be part of a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the majority hindu and minority muslim communities , and have also been connected to a rise in [[ islamophobia ]] throughout the 20th century . {{ sfn | herman | 2006 | p = 65 }} most incidents have occurred in the northern and western states of india , whereas communalist sentiment in the south and east is less pronounced . {{ sfn | cohen | 2013 | p = 66 }} among the largest incidents were [[ great calcutta killings ]] in 1946 , [[ noakhali riots # repercussions in bihar | bihar ]] and garmukhteshwar in 1946 after [[ noakhali riot ]] in east bengal , the massacre of muslims in [[ jammu division | jammu ]] in 1947 , large - scale killing of muslims following the [[ operation polo ]] in [[ hyderabad state | hyderabad ]] , anti - muslim riots in kolkata in the aftermath of [[ 1950 barisal riots ]] and [[ 1964 east - pakistan riots ]] , [[ 1969 gujarat riots ]] , [[ 1984 bhiwandi riot ]] , [[ 1985 gujarat riots ]] , [[ 1989 bhagalpur riots ]] , [[ bombay riots ]] , [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] in 1983 {{ sfn | ganguly | 2007 | p = 135 }} and [[ 2002 gujarat violence | gujarat riot ]] in 2002 and [[ 2013 muzaffarnagar riots ]] . these patterns of violence have been well - established since partition , with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . {{ sfn | pennington | 2012 | p = 32 }} over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 60 }} in 1989 , there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} [[ praveen swami ]] believes these periodic acts of violence have " scarred india ' s post independence history " and have also hindered india ' s cause in [[ jammu and kashmir ]] with regard to the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . {{ sfn | swami | 2006 | p = 217 }}
754580593 0 = = manifestation = = violence against muslims is frequently in the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segments of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs from one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the male members and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive including the children . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims . }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 | ps = : " violence perpetrated against muslims is now naturalized : riots are ' well - known and accepted transgression of routine political behavior in india . muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 60 }} in 1989 , there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} [[ praveen swami ]] believes these periodic acts of violence have " scarred india ' s post independence history " and have also hindered india ' s cause in [[ jammu and kashmir ]] with regard to the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . {{ sfn | swami | 2006 | p = 217 }} liars
776481614 0 however , a counter narrative must also be mentioned here on this page to put things in right perspective . it must be known that hindus were ruled by muslim invaders and later by mughals for almost 500 years starting from rule of delhi sultanate in 1206 . all along , except for slightly liberal rule of akbar , hindus were persecuted by muslim rulers with impunity and they were treated as second class citizens at best and had to pay a tax ( jizya ) for their fault of being a non - muslim . so , propagators of myth of ' violence against muslims in india ' must first agree that hindus were at the receiving end for 500 years without any chance of justice or retaliation . < ref > https : / / en . wikipedia . org / wiki / persecution _ of _ hindus < / ref > then came the british rule and as british were themselves imperial power , they carried a soft corner for muslim invaders and muslims in general to justify their presence in india . from 1757 to 1857 , though british were ruling india but most india still had muslim rulers managing the affairs at city , town , village and district levels . as such , hindus were in no position to cause riots . after 1857 , the salem ( tamil nadu ) riots of 1882 were first major riots and the cause was deliberate provocation by muslims by erecting a mosque right in path of a traditional hindu religious procession . most of the killed were hindus and the british had a very biased attitude towards the hindus . < ref > https : / / en . wikipedia . org / wiki / salem _ riots _ of _ 1882 < / ref > next major riot was the mappila riots of 1921 in malabar where muslims massacred , converted and drove away lakhs of hindu natives . < ref > https : / / en . wikipedia . org / wiki / mappila _ riots < / ref > in 1922 , nagpur riots ( maharashtra ) broke out just because muslims objected to a hindu religious procession . < ref > https : / / en . wikipedia . org / wiki / list _ of _ riots _ in _ india < / ref > on 16th august 1946 , muslim league launched a ' direct action day ' massacring hindus on a large scale because they felt that an independent india will be a hindu country and so were demanding a separate country ' pakistan ' for muslims . over 10 , 000 hindus were brutally massacred . < ref > https : / / en . wikipedia . org / wiki / direct _ action _ day < / ref > < ref > http : / / bharatuntoldstory . tumblr . com / post / 31643392621 / the - exact - number - of - casualties - during - the < / ref > the partition riots of 1947 were the bloodiest riots in history of world with estimated one million deaths or much more . most of the killed were hindus migrating from newly created pakistan to india . < ref > http : / / bharatuntoldstory . tumblr . com / post / 31643392621 / the - exact - number - of - casualties - during - the < / ref > after independence , almost every year hindu - muslim riots broke out in at least a dozen cities in india and any researcher can easily find out that the root cause in each riot was abject muslim intolerance against hindu religious festivals and their observance . so all the riots happened mostly in cities and towns of high muslim concentration but wherever muslims were very less in number , no riot occurred proving that hindus did not start or cause riots . however most indian historians were marxist and leftist and on possible payrolls of consecutive congress governments and had a stark bias against hindus and extreme soft corner towards muslims . in their penchant for proving themselves secular beyond doubt and to be in good books of ruling disposition for future plum postings , these historians blamed hindus for all hindus and muslim riots .
812875217 0 = = = 2002 gujarat violence = = = {{ main article | 2002 gujarat violence }} since partition , muslim community has been subject to and engaged in sectarian violence in [[ gujarat ]] . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} in [[ 2002 gujarat violence | 2002 ]] , in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror , " {{ sfn | singh | 2010 | p = 348 }} hindu [[ extremism | extremists ]] carried out acts of violence against the muslim minority population , in retaliation to on going sectarian violence and persecution by radicalised islamists , often backed by the pakistan intelligence services , with increasing support amongst the local muslim population . < ref > {{ cite news | url = https : / / www . theguardian . com / cities / 2014 / nov / 26 / india - terror - threat - mumbai - attacks | title = terror threat to india rising again six years after mumbai attacks | last = burke | first = jason | date = 2014 - 11 - 25 | newspaper = the guardian | language = en - gb | issn = 0261 - 3077 | access - date = 2016 - 04 - 19 }} < / ref > the starting point for the incident was the [[ godhra train burning ]] which was allegedly done by muslims . {{ sfn | tilly | 2006 | p = 119 }} during the incident , young girls were [[ rape in india | sexually assaulted ]] , burned or hacked to death . {{ sfn | holst | 2004 | p = 149 }} these rapes were condoned by the ruling bjp , {{ sfn | raman | 2009 | p = 210 }} {{ sfn | gangoli | 2007 | p = 42 }} whose refusal to intervene lead to the displacement of 200 , 000 . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 70 }} death toll figures range from the official estimate of 790 muslims and 254 hindus killed , to 2 , 000 muslims killed . {{ sfn | campbell | 2012 | p = 233 }} then chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215 }} according to brass , the only conclusion from the evidence which is available points to a methodical pogrom , which was carried out with " exceptional brutality and was highly coordinated " . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 388 }} in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a " state - sanctioned pogrom " . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }}
group 4
del_string ins_string
id
559540497 8 in the form of mob attacks on muslims , usually by hindus . these attacks , known as ' communal riots ' in india usually occur in northern and western states of india , with very few such incidents happening in the south where overt discrimination is not so prevalent . < ref name = cohen > {{ cite book | last = cohen | first = stephen p . | title = shooting for a century : the india - pakistan conundrum | year = 2013 | publisher = brookings institution press | isbn = 978 - 0815721864 | page = 66 }} < / ref > the largest of these incidents occurred in gujarat in 2002 < ref name = ganguly > {{ cite book | last = ganguly | first = rajat | title = the state of india ' s democracy | year = 2007 | publisher = the johns hopkins university press | isbn = 978 - 0801887918 | page = 59 | editor = sumit ganguly , larry diamond , marc f . plattner }} < / ref > and bihar in 1946 . < ref name = riddick > {{ cite book | last = riddick | first = john f . | title = the history of british india : a chronology | year = 2006 | publisher = praeger | isbn = 978 - 0313322808 | page = 118 }} < / ref > the roots of this violence lie in india ' s history , from lingering resentment toward the islamic domination of india during the middle ages , from policies followed by the british colonizers of india , and from the violent partition of india into an islamic pakistan and a secular india with a large but minority muslim population . < ref name = smith > {{ cite book | last = smith | first = glenn | title = violent internal conflicts in asia pacific : histories , political economies , and policies | year = 2005 | publisher = yayasan obor | isbn = 9789794615140 | pages = 11 - 12 | editor = asvi warman adam , dewi fortuna anwar }} < / ref > inside india , these attacks are categorised as riots , but numerous scholarly observers posit that this violence is often organised and political in nature . some scholars have called these attacks [[
60 < ref name = chandavarkar1 > {{ cite book | last = chandavarkar | first = rajnayaran | title = history , culture and the indian city | year = 2009 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521768719 | page = 114 | edition = 1st | date = 3 | month = september }} < / ref > bhiwandi 1984 < ref name = chandavarkar2 > {{ cite book | last = chandavarkar | first = rajnayaran | title = history , culture and the indian city | year = 2009 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521768719 | page = 113 | edition = 1st | date = | month = }} < / ref > according to sudipta kaviraj the vhp are still engaged in the religious conflicts which began in medieval times . < ref name = kaviraj > {{ cite book | last = kaviraj | first = sudipta | title = the imaginary institution of india : politics and ideas | year = 2010 | publisher = columbia university press | isbn = 978 - 0231152235 | page = 245 }} < / ref > another reason given for these outbreaks of violence is the upward mobility of the [[ caste system in india | lower castes ]] caused by the expansion of the economy . the violence has become a substitute for class tensions and nationalists , rather than deal with the claims from the lower class instead muslims and christians as they were not " fully indian " due to their religion . < ref name = metcalf > {{ cite book | last = metcalf | first = barbara | title = schooling islam : the culture and politics of modern muslim education | year = 2006 | publisher = princeton university press | isbn = 978 - 0691129334 | page = 89 | editor = robert w . hefner , muhammad qasim zaman }} < / ref > hindu nationalists also use the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | subjugation ]] of india by muslims as an excuse for violence . their narrative is that these conquerors had raped hindu women and destroyed places of worship . that since partition the muslims are allied to pakistan and possible terrorists and that the hindus must take revenge for these past wrongs and reassert their pride . < ref name = etzion > {{ cite book | last = etzion | first = amitai | title = security first : for a muscular , moral foreign policy | year = 2008 | publisher = yale university press | isbn = 978 - 0300143072 | pages = 123 - 124 }} < / ref >
70 . anti muslim violence creates a security risk for hindus residing outside of india . since the 1950s there have been retaliatory attacks on hindus in pakistan and bangladesh in response to anti muslim violence , after the 1992 violence hindu temples were attacked in britain , dubai and thailand . < ref name = wilkinson > {{ cite book | last = wilkinson | first = steven i . | title = votes and violence : electoral competition and ethnic riots in india | year = 2006 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521536059 | page = 16 }} < / ref > this recurring violence has become a rigidly conventional pattern which has created a divide between the muslim and hindu communities . < ref name = shani > {{ cite book | last = shani | first = ornit | title = communalism , caste and hindu nationalism : the violence in gujarat | year = 2007 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521727532 | page = 187 }} < / ref > [[ jamaat - e - islami hind ]] has spoken out against these communal clashes , as it believes that the violence not only impacts upon muslims but on india as a whole and that these riots are damaging to progress . < ref name = sikand > {{ cite book | last = sikand | first = yoginder | title = muslims in india since 1947 : islamic perspectives on inter - faith relations | year = 2004 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415314862 | page = 86 }} < / ref > in gujarat the [[ terrorist and disruptive activities ( prevention ) act ]] ( tada ) was used in incidents pertaining to communal violence , the majority of those arrested under the act were muslim , conversely tada was not used after the violence carried out against muslims during the bombay riots . < ref name = singh2 > {{ cite book | last = singh | first = ujjwal kumar | title = global anti - terrorism law and policy | year = 2012 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 9781107014671 | page = 427 | edition = 2nd | editor = victor v . ramraj , michael hor , kent roach }} < / ref > = = incidents = = in october 1946 in bihar between seven and eight thousand people were killed in an anti muslim riot , the hindu state governor refused to give the order to allow british troops to fire on the rioters , no enquiry was held and he ignored the complicity of members of congress who took part in the violence . < ref name = wilkinson > {{ cite book | last = wilkinson | first = steven i . | title = votes and violence : electoral competition and ethnic riots in india | year = 2006 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521536059 | page = 10 | date = 23 | month = november }} < / ref > < ref name = bihar > {{ cite journal | last = reference | first = blackwell | title = indian communal massacres ( 1946 – 7 ) | journal = blackwell reference | doi = 10 . 1111 / b . 9780631209379 . 1999 . x }} < / ref > < ref name = markovits > {{ cite web | last = markovits | first = claude | title = india from 1900 to 1947 | url = http : / / www . massviolence . org / india - from - 1900 - to - 1947 ? cs = print # outil _ sommaire _ 3 | publisher = mass violence . org }} < / ref > this rioting was caused in retaliation to reports of atrocities carried out against hindus in [[ noakhali genocide | noakhali ]] which in turn had been caused by reports of the atrocities which occoured as a result of [[ direct action day ]] in calcutta . < ref name = " d ' costa " > {{ cite book | last = d ' costa | first = bina | title = nationbuilding , gender and war crimes in south asia | year = 2010 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415565660 | page = 213 }} < / ref >

muslim violence | publisher = human rights watch | date = 1 may , 2002 | quote = not a spontaneous uprising , it was a carefully orchestrated attack against muslims . the attacks were planned in advance and organized with extensive participation of the police and state government officials }} < / ref > < ref name = " krishnan " > {{ cite news | last = krishnan | first = murali | title = modi ' s clearance in the gujarat riots case angers indian muslims | url = http : / / www . dw . de / modis - clearance - in - the - gujarat - riots - case - angers - indian - muslims / a - 15874606 | newspaper = deutsche welle | date = 11 march , 2012 | author2 = shamil shams }} < / ref >
563547587 0 these incidents have been described by [[ gyanendra pandey ( historian ) | gyanendra pandey ]] as a new form of [[ state terrorism ]] , and that these are not riots but " organized political massacres " . < ref name = " pandey " / > in 1989 there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . < ref name = " chandavarkar2 " / > according to [[ stanley jeyaraja tambiah ]] the violence in bhagalpur in [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | 1989 ]] , hashimpura in [[ hashimpura massacre | 1987 ]] and in moradabad [[ 1980 moradabad riots | 1980 ]] were organised killings . < ref name = " tambiah " / > [[ praveen swami ]] believes these periodic acts of violence have " scarred india ' s post independence history " and have also hindered india ' s cause in [[ jammu and kashmir ]] . < ref name = " swami " / > according to research by political scientist [[ paul brass ]] , though these acts of violence are usually referred to as riots they habitually become massacres of muslims and pogroms with relatively few hindus being killed . < ref name = " brass1 " / > brass argues that in affected areas there are " “institutionalized riot systems , ” in which the organizations of militant [[ hindu nationalism ]] are deeply implicated . " < ref name = " brass2 " / > his research also shows that those organizations that are a part of the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) , the [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] ( vhp ) and the [[ bajrang dal ]] all have a central role in the violence . < ref name = " brass3 " / > when it was founded in 1925 the rss saw itself as having the role of protecting hindus against muslims , and since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , < ref name = " jaffrelot 1996 " / > < ref name = " sarkur " / > it has formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india . < ref name = " brekke " / >
575756430 289 > * {{ cite book | last = singh | first = ujjwal kumar | title = global anti - terrorism law and policy | year = 2012 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 9781107014671 | page = 427 | edition = 2nd | editor = victor v . ramraj , michael hor , kent roach | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = sarkur | first = tanika | title = women and the politics of violence | year = 2007 | publisher = har anand | isbn = 978 - 8124108475 | editor = taisha abraham | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = swami | first = praveen | title = india , pakistan and the secret jihad : the covert war in kashmir , 1947 – 2004 | year = 2006 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415404594 | date = 19 | month = october | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = smith | first = glenn | title = violent internal conflicts in asia pacific : histories , political economies , and policies | year = 2005 | publisher = yayasan obor | isbn = 9789794615140 | editor = asvi warman adam , dewi fortuna anwar | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = sikand | first = yoginder | title = muslims in india since 1947 : islamic perspectives on inter - faith relations | year = 2004 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415314862 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = shani | first = ornit | title = communalism , caste and hindu nationalism : the violence in gujarat | year = 2007 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521727532 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = singh | first = sujala | title = terror and the postcolonial : a concise companion | year = 2009 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405191548 | editor = elleke boehmer , stephen morton | quote = one of the most horrific instances of fascistic state terror took place in gujarat in 2002 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = tilly | first = charles | title = regimes and repertoires | year = 2006 | publisher = university of chicago press | isbn = 978 - ibn | date = 2 september 2007 | ref = {{ sfnref | varia | 2007 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = ethnic conflict and civic life : hindus and muslims in india | year = 2003 | publisher = yale university press | isbn = 978 - 0300100136 | page = 8 | edition = 2nd revised | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = vickery | first = jacqueline | title = encyclopedia of social movement media | year = 2010 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0761926887 | editor = john d . h . downing | date = 30 | month = december | ref = harv }} * {{ cite web | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = understanding gujarat violence | url =
583806338 0 = = = 2002 gujarat violence = = = since partition , there have been several acts of mass violence carried out against muslims in [[ gujarat ]] . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} in [[ 2002 gujarat violence | 2002 ]] , in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror , " {{ sfn | singh | 2009 | p = 248 }} hindu [[ extremism | extremists ]] carried out acts of extreme violence against the muslim minority population . the starting point for the incident was the [[ godhra train burning | attack ]] on a train , which was blamed on muslims . {{ sfn | tilly | 2006 | p = 119 }} during the incident , young girls were [[ rape in india | sexually assaulted ]] , burned or hacked to death . {{ sfn | holst | 2004 | p = 149 }} these rapes were condoned by the ruling bjp , {{ sfn | raman | 2009 | p = 210 }} {{ sfn | gangoli | 2007 | p = 42 }} whose refusal to intervene lead to the displacement of 200 , 000 . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 70 }} death toll figures range from the official estimate of 790 muslims and 254 hindus killed , to 2 , 000 muslims killed . {{ sfn | campbell | 2012 | p = 233 }} chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215 }} according to brass , the only conclusion from the evidence which is available points to a methodical pogrom , which was carried out with exceptional brutality and was highly coordinated . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 388 }} in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a state - sanctioned pogrom . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }}
586348385 0 = = = 2012 assam violence = = = in july 2012 violence in the indian state of assam broke out with riots between indigenous bodos and muslims . [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] [ 8 ] [ 9 ] the first incident was reported to have taken place on 20 july 2012 . [ 10 ] as of 8 august 2012 , 77 people had died [ 11 ] and over 400 , 000 people were taking shelter in 270 relief camps , after being displaced from almost 400 villages . [ 12 ] [ 13 ] [ 13 ] eleven people have been reported missing . [ 14 ] [ 15 ] on 27 july 2012 , assam ' s chief minister tarun gogoi blamed the upa led national government for a " delay in army deployment to riot - hit areas " . [ 16 ] the next day , indian prime minister manmohan singh visited the relief camps in kokrajhar and called the recent violence a blot on the face of india . indian home minister p . chidambaram visited the state on monday , 30 july to review the security situation and the relief and rehabilitation measures being taken . [ 17 ] lok sabha member from bodoland , sansuma khunggur bwiswmuthiary blamed illegal immigration for the violence in the state . [ 18 ] the election commissioner of india , h . s . brahma , said that of the 27 districts in assam , 11 of them will be shown to have a muslim majority when the 2011 census figures are published . [ 4 ] [ 19 ] prime minister manmohan singh was criticised for not dealing with the flood of illegal immigrants from bangladesh . [ 20 ] the violence and exodus of thousands of people from north east reportedly led to a series of incessant protests in assam , at multiple locations , during the months of august – september . the protesters ' main demand was expeditious detection and deportation of illegal infiltrators from assam . on 15 september , at a convention of non - political tribal groups , organisations representing bodo , dimasa , tiwa , deuri , karbi , garo , rabha , sonowal kachari and other tribal communities decided to form a coordination committee for the cause . the tribal leaders said that illegal immigration has threatened the existence , right to land and resources to all indigenous people of the entire state , and it was not limited to bodoland alone . [ 21 ]
608667294 4 acts of communal violence against the minority [[ islam the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segnents of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs form one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the malemembers and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims . }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 }} such attacks , often referred to as " [[ communalism ( south asia ) | communal riots ]] " in india , are part of a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the hindu and muslim communities , which has been connected to a rise in [[ islamophobia | anti - muslim sentiment ]] throughout the 20th century . {{ sfn | herman | 2006 | p = 65 }} most incidents have occurred in the northern and western states of india , whereas communalist sentiment in the south is less pronounced . {{ sfn | cohen | 2013 | p = 66 }} among the largest incidents were [[ bihar ]] in 1946 , {{ sfn | riddick | 2006 | p = 118 }} [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] in 1983 {{ sfn | ganguly | 2007 | p = 135 }} and [[ 2002 gujarat violence | gujarat ]] in 2002 . {{ sfn | engineer | 2002 | pp = 5047 - 5054 }} the roots of this violence lie in india ' s history , stemming from lingering resentment toward the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | islamic domination ]] of india during the [[ middle ages ]] , policies established by the country ' s [[ british raj | british colonizers ]] , the violent partition of india into a muslim [[ pakistan ]] , and a secular india with a large but minority [[ islam in india | muslim population ]] . {{ sfn | smith | 2005 | pp = 11 – 12 }} many scholars have described incidents of anti - muslim violence as politically motivated and organized , preferring to call them [[ pogrom
46 {{ sfn | brass | a }} his research also shows that those organizations that are a part of the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) — such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) , the [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] ( vhp ) and the [[ bajrang dal ]] — all have a central role in the violence . {{ sfn | brass | b }} when it was founded in 1925 , the rss saw itself as having the role of protecting hindus against muslims and , since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 1996 | p = ? }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} it has formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india . {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} = = = police actions = = = brass gives an example of [[ police action ]] s in [[ uttar pradesh ]] where the state itself is not [[ institutional racism | institutionalised ]] as anti - muslim , nor are the police . their actions or inactions depend on who is in power at the time and , though some officers will act according to their beliefs , their actions are constrained by those with political power . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 328 }} french political scientist
68 the | 2005 | p = 160 }} {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} according to [[ sudipta kaviraj ]] the vhp are still engaged in the religious conflicts which began in medieval times . {{ sfn | kaviraj | 2010 | p = 245 }} another reason given for these outbreaks of violence is the upward mobility of the [[ caste system in india | lower castes ]] caused by the expansion of the economy . the violence has become a substitute for class tensions . nationalists , rather than deal with the claims from the lower class , instead view muslims and christians as not " fully indian " due to their religion . {{ sfn | metcalf | 2006 | p = 89 }} hindu nationalists also use the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | subjugation ]] of india by muslims as an excuse for violence . their view is that these conquerors had raped hindu women and destroyed places of worship . they feel that , since partition , the muslims are [[ pro - pakistan sentiment | allied to pakistan ]] and are possible terrorists and , therefore , the hindus must take revenge for these past wrongs and reassert their pride . {{ sfn | etzion | 2008 | pp = 123 – 124 }} the higher fertility rate among muslims has been a recurring theme in the hindu rights rhetoric . they claim that the [[ islam in india # population growth rate | higher ]] birth rate amongst muslims is part of a plan to turn the hindus into a minority within their own country . {{ sfn | weigl | 2012 | p = 19 }} jaffrelot has said that modi , in his election campaign following the violence in 2002 in gujarat , referred to the higher birth rate of muslims which is " something hindus fear " . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 384 }} [[ file : calcutta 1946 riot . jpg | left | thumb | 300px |
77 these pogroms {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 121 }} anti - muslim violence creates a security risk for hindus residing outside of india . since the 1950s , there have been retaliatory attacks on hindus in pakistan and [[ bangladesh ]] in response to anti - muslim violence , after the 1992 violence hindu temples were attacked in [[ great britain | britain ]] , [[ dubai ]] and [[ thailand ]] . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 16 }} this recurring violence has become a rigidly conventional pattern which has created a divide between the muslim and hindu communities . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 187 }} [[ jamaat - e - islami hind ]] has spoken out against these communal clashes , as it believes that the violence not only impacts upon muslims , but on india as a whole , and that these riots are damaging to progress . {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 86 }} in gujarat , the [[ terrorist and disruptive activities ( prevention ) act ]] ( tada ) was used in incidents pertaining to communal violence in 1992 and 1993 . the majority of those arrested under the act were muslim . conversely , tada was not used after the violence carried out against muslims during the [[ bombay riots ]] . {{ sfn | singh | 2012 | p = 427 }} = = = demographics = = = the bjp , as well as other politicians , argue that [[ demographics ]] play an essential role in indian elections . the bjp believe that the higher the number of muslims within a constituency , the higher are the chances of parties from the center to agree with minority groups ' requests , which lowers the chances of muslims " building bridges " with their hindu neighbors . as such , according to this argument " muslim appeasement " is the root cause of communal violence . {{ sfn | varshney | 2003 | p = 8 }} susanne and lloyd rudolph argue that economic disparity is a reason for the aggression shown towards muslims by hindus . as india ' s economy expanded due to [[ globalization ]] and [[ investment ]] from overseas companies , the expectations of the hindu population were not matched by opportunities . hindu nationalists then encouraged this perception , which leads the hindus to view muslims as the source of their troubles . {{ sfn | price | 2012 | p = 95 }} the actions of anti - hindu and anti - india militant groups in [[ kashmir conflict | kashmir ]] and pakistan have reinforced anti - muslim feelings in india , which has strengthened the hindu right ( hindutva ) . the hindutva discourse portrays muslims as traitors and state enemies , whose patriotism is suspected . {{ sfn | sikand | 2006 | p = 88 }} [[ sumit ganguly ]] argues that the rise in terrorism cannot only be attributed to [[ socioeconomics | socioeconomic ]] factors , but also to the violence perpetrated by hindutva forces . {{ sfn | ganguly | 2003 | p = 10 }} = = major incidents = = in october 1946 , in bihar , between 7 , 000 and 8 , 000 people were killed in an anti - muslim riot . the hindu chief minister refused to allow british troops to fire on the rioters . no enquiry was held , and he ignored the complicity of members of the [[ indian national congress | congress ]] party who took part in the violence . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 10 }} {{ sfn | bihar }} {{ sfn | markovits }} this rioting was in retaliation to the [[ noakhali carnage ]] against hindus which , in turn , was a reaction against the atrocities of [[ direct action day ]] in [[ kolkata | calcutta ]] . {{ sfn | d ' costa | 2010 | p = 213 }} = = = 1983 nellie massacre = = = in
86 > {{ cite book | last = hussain | first = monirul | title = the fleeing people of south asia : selections from refugee watch | year = 2009 | publisher = anthem | isbn = 978 - 8190583572 | page = 261 | editor = sibaji pratim basu }} < / ref > estimates {{ sfn | datta | 2012 | p = 183 }} the assam movement insisted on striking the names of [[ illegal immigration | illegal immigrants ]] from the electoral register and their deportation from the state . there was widespread support for the movement , which tapered off between 1981 and 1982 . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 481 }} the movement demanded that anyone who had entered the state illegally since 1951 be deported . the central government , however , insisted on a cutoff date of 1971 . towards the end of 1982 , the central government called elections and the movement called for people to [[ boycott ]] it , which led to the widespread violence . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 418 }} since the incident , no investigation has ever been launched . {{ sfn | saikia | 2011 | pp = 263 – 264 }} the massacre stands as a testament that the [[ all assam students union ]] ( aasu ) had left behind the economic reasons for the protests and the non violent methods they had employed up until then , and that they had become influenced by religious politics . the aasu denied any involvement in the massacre and ensured that there were no further instances of organized violence after the incident at nellie . since , then there have been no instances of communal violence in [[ upper assam division | upper assam ]] . {{ sfn | saikia | 2005 | p = 65 }} = = = 1969 gujarat riots = = = during the

168 = {{ sfnref | krishnan | 2012 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = khalidi | first = omar | title = islam and democratization in asia | date = 28 december 2009 | publisher = cambria press | isbn = 978 - 0313386381 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = prakash | first = gyan | title = the crisis of secularism in india | date = 15 february 2007 | publisher = duke university press | isbn = 978 - 0822338468 | editor = anuradha dingwaney needham , rajeswari sunder rajan | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = puniyan | first = ram | title = communal politics : facts versus myths | year = 2003 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0813543451 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = singh | first = sujala | title = terror and the postcolonial : a concise companion | year = 2009 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405191548 | page = 248 | editor = elleke boehmer , stephen morton | quote = one of the most horrific instances of fascistic state terror took place in gujarat in 2002 }} * {{ cite news | last = narula | first = smita | title = india : gujarat officials took part in anti - muslim violence | publisher = human rights watch | date = 1 may 2002 | quote = not a spontaneous uprising , it was a carefully orchestrated attack against muslims . the attacks were planned in advance and organised with extensive participation of the police and state government officials | ref = {{ sfnref | narula | 2002 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = shani | first = giorgio | title = sikh nationalism and identity in a global age | year = 2007 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415421904 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = saikia | first = yasmin | title = women , war , and the making of bangladesh : remembering 1971 | year = 2011 | publisher = duke university press | isbn = 978 - 0822350385 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = saikia | first = yasmin | title = fragmented memories : struggling to be tai - ahom in india | year = 2005 | publisher = duke university press | isbn = 978 - 0822333739 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = sikand | first = yoginder | title = the blackwell companion to contemporary islamic thought | year = 2006 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405121743 | page = 88 | editor = ibrahim abu - rabi ' | quote = in the fascist hindutva imagination , the indian muslims are continuously reviled as pakistani " fifth columnists , " as " enemies of the nation " and so on , and their patriotism is said to be suspect . the muslim as the menacing " other " occupies a central place in hindutva discourse , and this has been used to legitimize large - scale anti - muslim violence . | ref = harv
169 {{ reflist }} [[ category : pogroms ]] [[ category : anti - muslim pogroms in india ]] * {{ cite book | last = singh | first = ujjwal kumar | title = global anti - terrorism law and policy | year = 2012 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 9781107014671 | page = 427 | edition = 2nd | editor = victor v . ramraj , michael hor , kent roach | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = sarkur | first = tanika | title = women and the politics of violence | year = 2007 | publisher = har anand | isbn = 978 - 8124108475 | editor = taisha abraham | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = swami | first = praveen | title = india , pakistan and the secret jihad : the covert war in kashmir , 1947 – 2004 | date = 19 october 2006 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415404594 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = smith | first = glenn | title = violent internal conflicts in asia pacific : histories , political economies , and policies | year = 2005 | publisher = yayasan obor | isbn = 9789794615140 | editor = asvi warman adam , dewi fortuna anwar | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = sikand | first = yoginder | title = muslims in india since 1947 : islamic perspectives on inter - faith relations | year = 2004 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415314862 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = shani | first = ornit | title = communalism , caste and hindu nationalism : the violence in gujarat | year = 2007 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521727532 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = singh | first = sujala | title = terror and the postcolonial : a concise companion | year = 2009 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405191548 | editor = elleke boehmer , stephen morton | quote = one of the most horrific instances of fascistic state terror took place in gujarat in 2002 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = tilly | first = charles | title = regimes and repertoires | year = 2006 | publisher = university of chicago press | isbn = 978 - 0226803500 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite book | last = tambiah | first = stanely j . | title = leveling crowds : ethnonationalist conflicts and collective violence in south asia | year = 1997 | publisher = university of california press | isbn = 978 - 0520206427 | ref = harv }} * {{ cite news | last = times of india | first = tnn | title = state pogroms glossed over | newspaper = the times of india | date = 31 december 2005 | ref = {{ sfnref | times of india | 2005 }} }} * {{ cite news | last = varia | first = toral | title = mumbai riots a planned , perfected pogrom ? | newspaper = cnn - ibn | date = 2 september 2007 | ref = {{ sfnref | varia | 2007 }} }} * {{ cite book | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = ethnic conflict and civic life : hindus and muslims in india | year = 2003 | publisher = yale university press | isbn = 978 - 0761926887 | editor = john d . h . downing | ref = harv }} * {{ cite web | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = understanding gujarat violence | url = http : / / conconflicts . ssrc . org / archives / gujarat / varshney / | publisher = social science research council | ref = {{ sfnref | varshney }} }} * {{ cite book | last = weigl | first = constanze | title = reproductive health behaviour and decision -
