599181677 0 moreover , the muslims in india do not live in fear , the way minorities in pakistan live , as the indian government has implemented many welfare schemes for muslims , like ( a ) reservation in education and government jobs , ( b ) 20 % reservation for muslims in the police force , wherever muslims are more than 20 % of the population ( deemed communally sensitive areas ) , ( c ) rs . 50 , 000 / - dowry ( bidaai ) to muslim girls at the time of their marriage , ( d ) implementation of the recommendations of the [[ sachar committee report | sachar committee ]] and so on and muslims are pampered as a part of vote bank politics in india .
604146321 8 | 2012 | p = 2 }} others argue that , although their community faces discrimination and violence , some muslims have been highly successful , {{ sfn | metcalf | 2013 | p = 109 }} that the violence is not as widespread as it appears , but is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions , and there are many cities where muslims and hindus live peacefully together with almost no incidences of sectarian violence . {{ sfn | varshney }} according to [[ political science | political scientists ]] , organizations with roots in [[ hindu nationalism ]] have played a large part in in 1971 , 1984 , 1986 and 1992 - 93 . < ref name =
19 the bjp , and its predecessor the [[ jana sangh ]] , have used these communal riots and anti - muslim [[ propaganda ]] as a part of a larger political strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} these incidents of violence against muslims have marred india ’ s post independence history with a spill - over effect on india ’ s cause in the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . hindu [[ right - wing politics | right - wing ]] politicians will often legitimize instances of mass violence against muslims as a natural reaction to actions perpetrated by muslims in the past and the present . however , these patterns of violence have been well - established since partition , with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . {{ sfn | pennington | 2012 | p = 32 }} over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 60 }} > {{ cite book | last = swami | first = praveen | title = india , pakistan and the secret jihad : the covert war in kashmir , 1947 - 2004 | year = 2006 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415404594 | page = 217 }} < / ref >
53 {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} one reason given for anti - muslim violence is the ill will , which is still prevalent after the violence during partition . muslims are viewed as suspect and their loyalty to the state is questioned . this tension will at times explode into mass violence against the muslim population . {{ sfn | hefner | 2006 | p = 23 }} according to [[ omar khalidi ]] : < blockquote > anti - muslim violence is planned and executed to render muslims economically and socially crippled and , as a final outcome of that economic and social backwardness , assimilating them into lower rungs of hindu society . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | p = 153 }} < ref name = mander > {{ cite news | last = mander | first = harsh | title = india ' s pogroms : a sense of betrayal | newspaper = the hindu | date = 27 march , 2011 }} < / ref >

red _ pog . svg | position = farright | lat = 28 . 99 | long = 77 . 70 }} }} these incidents have been described by [[ gyanendra pandey ( historian ) | gyanendra pandey ]] as a new form of [[ state terrorism ]] , stating that these are not " riots " but " organized political massacres " . {{ sfn | pandey | 2005 | p = 188 }} in 1989 , there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }}
159 {{ sfn | brass | a }} his research also shows that those organizations that are a part of the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) — such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) , the [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] ( vhp ) and the [[ bajrang dal ]] — all have a central role in the violence . {{ sfn | brass | b }} when it was founded in 1925 , the rss saw itself as having the role of protecting hindus against muslims and , since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 1996 | p = ? }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} it has formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india . {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} = = = police actions = = = brass gives an example of [[ police action ]] s in [[ uttar pradesh ]] where the state itself is not [[ institutional racism | institutionalised ]] as anti - muslim , nor are the police . their actions or inactions depend on who is in power at the time and , though some officers will act according to their beliefs , their actions are constrained by those with political power . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 328 }} french political scientist
162 = = = cultural nationalism = = = [[ cultural nationalism ]] has also been given as a reason for instances of violence carried out by [[ shiv sena ]] , a [[ fascism | fascist ]] political party . they initially claimed to speak for the people of [[ maharashtra ]] , but their [[ rhetoric ]] quickly turned to inciting violence against muslims . they were complicit in the violence in 1984 in the town of [[ bhiwandi ]] , and again in the violence in [[ mumbai | bombay ]] in 1992 and 1993 . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} in both of these instances , sena had help from the police and local officials . violence has been incited by sena in 1971 and 1986 . {{ sfn |
163 | 2005 | p = 160 }} {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} according to [[ sudipta kaviraj ]] the vhp are still engaged in the religious conflicts which began in medieval times . {{ sfn | kaviraj | 2010 | p = 245 }} another reason given for these outbreaks of violence is the upward mobility of the [[ caste system in india | lower castes ]] caused by the expansion of the economy . the violence has become a substitute for class tensions . nationalists , rather than deal with the claims from the lower class , instead view muslims and christians as not " fully indian " due to their religion . {{ sfn | metcalf | 2006 | p = 89 }} hindu nationalists also use the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | subjugation ]] of india by muslims as an excuse for violence . their view is that these conquerors had raped hindu women and destroyed places of worship . they feel that , since partition , the muslims are [[ pro - pakistan sentiment | allied to pakistan ]] and are possible terrorists and , therefore , the hindus must take revenge for these past wrongs and reassert their pride . {{ sfn | etzion | 2008 | pp = 123 – 124 }} the higher fertility rate among muslims has been a recurring theme in the hindu rights rhetoric . they claim that the [[ islam in india # population growth rate | higher ]] birth rate amongst muslims is part of a plan to turn the hindus into a minority within their own country . {{ sfn | weigl | 2012 | p = 19 }} jaffrelot has said that modi , in his election campaign following the violence in 2002 in gujarat , referred to the higher birth rate of muslims which is " something hindus fear " . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 384 }} [[ file : calcutta 1946 riot . jpg | left | thumb | 300px |
181 {{ sfn | datta | 2012 | p = 183 }} the assam movement insisted on striking the names of [[ illegal immigration | illegal immigrants ]] from the electoral register and their deportation from the state . there was widespread support for the movement , which tapered off between 1981 and 1982 . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 481 }} the movement demanded that anyone who had entered the state illegally since 1951 be deported . the central government , however , insisted on a cutoff date of 1971 . towards the end of 1982 , the central government called elections and the movement called for people to [[ boycott ]] it , which led to the widespread violence . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 418 }} since the incident , no investigation has ever been launched . {{ sfn | saikia | 2011 | pp = 263 – 264 }} the massacre stands as a testament that the [[ all assam students union ]] ( aasu ) had left behind the economic reasons for the protests and the non violent methods they had employed up until then , and that they had become influenced by religious politics . the aasu denied any involvement in the massacre and ensured that there were no further instances of organized violence after the incident at nellie . since , then there have been no instances of communal violence in [[ upper assam division | upper assam ]] . {{ sfn | saikia | 2005 | p = 65 }} = = = 1969 gujarat riots = = = during the
204 | 2007 }} writer [[ arundhati roy ]] wrote the essay " fascism ' s firm footprint in india " in ' ' the nation ' ' , arguing that the attack had been a " meticulously planned pogrom " . < ref > arundhati roy . 2002 . fascism ’ s firm footprint in india 30 september 2002 . the nation [ http : / / www . xtome . org / docs / countries / india / ar093002 . pdf ] < / ref > several scholars have likewise concluded that the riots must have been pre - planned , and that hindu rioters had been given access to information about the locations of muslim homes and businesses from non - public sources . < ref > chris ogden . a lasting legacy : the bjp - led national democratic alliance and india ' s politics . journal of contemporary asia . vol . 42 , iss . 1 , 2012 < / ref
206 {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 254 }} a high - ranking member of the special branch , v . deshmukh , gave evidence to the commission tasked with probing the riots . he said the failures in intelligence and prevention had been due to political assurances that the [[ mosque ]] in [[ ayodhya ]] would be protected , that the police were fully aware of the shiv sena ' s capabilities to commit acts of violence , and that they had incited hate against the minority communities . {{ sfn | blom hansen | 2001 | p = 137 }} [[ file : ahmedabad riots1 . jpg | thumb | 250px | < center > the skyline of ahmedabad filled with smoke as buildings and shops are set on fire by rioting mobs < / center > . ]] = = = 2002 gujarat violence = = =
243 {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 388 }} in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a state - sanctioned pogrom . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }}
608667294 7 > {{ cite book | last = ghassem - fachandi | first = parvis | title = pogrom in gujarat : hindu nationalism and anti - muslim violence in india | year = 2012 | publisher = princeton university press | isbn = 978 - 0691151779 | page = 2 | url = http : / / books . google . co . in / books ? id = efnjja _ xefsc & printsec = frontcover & dq = pogrom + in + gujarat : + hindu + nationalism + and + anti - muslim + violence + in + india & hl = en & sa = x & ei = wv2xuft7m9hirqfkv4hwcw & ved = 0cc4q6aewaa | accessdate = 7 june 2013 }} < / ref > since [[ partition of india | partition ]] these pogroms have been endemic in india . < ref name = riaz > {{ cite book | last = riaz | first = ali | title = faithful education : madrassahs in south asia | year = 2008 | publisher = rutgers university press | isbn = 978 - 0813543451 | page = 165 }} < / ref > pogroms have been incited by the nationalist group [[ shiv sena 117 }} {{ sfn |
612514820 17 as [[ communal violence | communal riots ]] in india , are part of a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the hindu and muslim communities , which has been connected to a rise in [[ islamophobia ]] throughout the 20th century . {{ sfn | herman | 2006 | p = 65 }} most incidents have occurred in the northern and western states of india , whereas communalist sentiment in the south is less pronounced . {{ sfn | cohen | 2013 | p = 66 }} among the largest incidents were [[ noakhali riots # repercussions in bihar | bihar ]] in 1946 , {{ sfn | riddick | 2006 | p = 118 }} [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] in 1983 {{ sfn | ganguly | 2007 | p = 135 }} and [[ 2002 gujarat violence | gujarat ]] in 2002 . {{ sfn | engineer | 2002 | pp = 5047 - 5054 }} the roots of this violence
27 according to [[ christophe jaffrelot ]] , a [[ political science | political scientist ]] , organizations with roots in [[ hindu nationalism ]] have played a large part in these incidents of anti - muslim violence , and in generating anti - muslim sentiment . organizations associated with the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] , such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] , [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] and [[ bajrang dal ]] are all considered by scholars {{ who | date = may 2014 }} to have a central role in the violence . the bjp , and its predecessor the [[ jana sangh ]] , have used these communal riots and anti - muslim [[ propaganda ]] as a part of a larger political strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }}
612784099 12 ]] — all have a central role in the violence . {{ sfn | brass | b }} when it was founded in 1925 , the rss saw itself as having the role of protecting hindus against muslims and , since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 1996 | p = ? }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} it has formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india . {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} according to [[ christophe jaffrelot ]] , a [[ political science | political scientist ]] , organizations with roots in [[ hindu nationalism
612788531 20 political strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} brass gives an example of [[ police action ]] s in [[ uttar pradesh ]] where the state itself is not [[ institutional racism | institutionalised ]] as anti - muslim , nor are the police . their actions or inactions depend on who is in power at the time and , though some officers will act according to their beliefs , their actions are constrained by those with political power . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 328 }} french political scientist [[ christophe jaffrelot ]] said that some of these incidents are a result of an
624194375 1 although many illiterate muslims in india generally get into communal violence activities frequently against other common people , there are very rare occurrences of revolts by other communities . religious violence in india has started since the foreign intrusions into india . hindus , jains , sikhs , buddhists lived with tolerance and mutual respect . some leaders with provocative statements trigger the communal violence for their personal benefits . even though other communities believe in mutual respect ,
634994950 2 in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a state - sanctioned pogrom . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }}
634995804 0 [[ cultural nationalism ]] has also been given as a reason for instances of violence carried out by [[ shiv sena ]] , a [[ fascism | fascist ]] political party which initially claimed to speak for the people of [[ maharashtra ]] , but quickly turned their [[ rhetoric ]] to inciting violence against muslims . the shiv sena were complicit in the violence in 1984 in the town of [[ bhiwandi ]] , and again in the violence in [[ mumbai | bombay ]] in 1992 and 1993 . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} in both of these instances , sena had help from the police and local officials . violence has been incited by sena in 1971 and 1986 . {{ sfn | kaur | 2005 | p = 160 }} {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} according to [[ sudipta kaviraj ]] the vhp are still engaged in the religious conflicts which began in medieval times . {{ sfn | kaviraj | 2010 | p = 245 }}
640529354 19 however , this claim is far from the truth and in a majority of cases , just the opposite . the researchers and social scientists fail to understand that muslims would have been extinct had such anti - islamic campaign would have actually continued . influenced by political correctness and appeasement , they totally neglect the fact that the sole reason muslims remain backward , is because of their unwillingness towards education especially the girl child . moreover , cherry - picking facts to bolster their research in favor of the muslims have further deviated them from the fact that most of the muslim countries have extremely low literacy rate for the same reasons .
640542155 0 there have been periodic instances of ' ' ' violence against muslims in india ' ' ' ( referred to as [[ communal violence | communal riots ]] in india ) since its [[ partition of india | partition from pakistan ]] in 1947 , frequently in the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s that form a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the hindu and muslim communities . over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 in 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 . the causes of this [[ violence against muslims ]] are varied . the roots are thought to lie in india ' s history – resentment toward the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | islamic domination ]] of india during the [[ middle ages ]] , policies established by the country ' s [[ british raj | british colonizers ]] , and the violent partition of india into a muslim [[ pakistan ]] . many scholars believe that incidents of anti - muslim violence are politically motivated and a part of the electoral strategy of mainstream political parties associated with hindu nationalism . other scholars believe that the violence is not widespread but that it is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions .
654760262 0 = = = 2006 mangalore riots = = = the mangalore riots were a set of riots in [[ mangalore ]] triggered by an attack by [[ hindu ]] activists on a van carrying cows for the slaughter house . < ref name = autogenerated2 > {{ cite news | url = http : / / expressindia . indianexpress . com / news / fullstory . php ? newsid = 75131 | title = mangalore tense after riots | publisher = [[ express india ]] }} < / ref > < ref name = autogenerated1 > {{ cite web | url = http : / / www . rediff . com / news / 2006 / oct / 07ktaka . htm | title = violence breaks out in mangalore again | publisher = [[ rediff ]] | accessdate = 28 february 2014 }} < / ref > < ref > {{ cite news | url = http : / / www . business - standard . com / article / economy - policy / mangalore - riots - centre - steps - in - curfew - relaxed - 106100901068 _ 1 . html | title = mangalore riots : centre steps in , curfew relaxed | publisher = [[ business standard ]] }} < / ref > on 4 october 2006 , [[ bajrang dal ]] activists stopped a vehicle carrying stolen cattle for the slaughterhouse and attacked it , complaining that the police were not willing to address the stealing of cows by some [[ muslim ]] youth . this incited a riot between the two religious communities . around 50 people were injured in stone pelting incidents , and a further 200 were arrested after a curfew was imposed . the curfew was extended after one of the injured muslims died of his injuries on 6 october . < ref > {{ cite news | url = http : / / articles . timesofindia . indiatimes . com / 2006 - 10 - 07 / india / 27793442 _ 1 _ communal - clashes - curfew - members - of - two - communities | title = curfew extended to mangalore city limits | publisher = [[ times of india ]] }} < / ref > fresh violence broke out in neighbouring regions , killing one other person . the curfew was slowly relaxed after 8 october , < ref > {{ cite web | url = http : / / www . rediff . com / news / 2006 / oct / 09mlore . htm | title = curfew relaxed in mangalore | publisher = [[ rediff ]] | accessdate = 28 february 2014 }} < / ref > and eventually removed . < ref > {{ cite news | url = http : / / articles . timesofindia . indiatimes . com / 2006 - 10 - 14 / india / 27792630 _ 1 _ prohibitory - orders - mangalore - bajrang - dal - activists | title = situation peaceful in mangalore after riots | publisher = [[ times of india ]] }} < / ref >
654768005 0 = = = 1994 anti - urdu riots = = = on august 15 , 1994 [[ hubli ]] which was reeling communal tensions for some time over the idgah maidan ( a piece of open land held by the anjuman - e - islam ( aei ) , a [[ muslim ]] organization ) . the land was leased out to aei in 1921 by [[ hubli - dharwad municipal corporation ]] then known as hubli municipality for religious purposes . but on independence day in 1994 two [[ bharatiya janata party ]] leaders , sikander bakht and uma bharti , joined the flag - hoisting campaign in hubli on the idgah maidan thereby provoking the indignation of the aei . they were arrested and 6 people were killed due to police firing leading to communal flareup in the region . on october 1994 , hindu - muslim clashes which took place in jagajeevanram nagar in the city of bangalore in india in 1994 . the riots were are believed to be a reaction against telecast of urdu news on the india ' s national television channel , doordarshan at prime - time . the riots resulted in over 25 deaths . < ref name = " bangalore riots " > {{ cite web | url = http : / / www . massviolence . org / hindu - muslim - communal - riots - in , 738 ? artpage = 21 - 30 | title = bangalore riots }} < / ref >
654769163 0 [[ wali mohammed wali ]] was the first [[ urdu language | urdu ]] [[ ghazal ]] poet . wali ' s tomb in [[ shahibaug ]] locality of [[ ahmedabad ]] was damaged in [[ 2002 gujarat riots ]] and later lost when [[ road roller ]] was run on it and a road was constructed . < ref > [ http : / / timesofindia . indiatimes . com / city / ahmedabad / wali - gujaratis - tomb - may - be - rebuilt - following - hc - directions / articleshow / 11830229 . cms ? referral = pm wali gujarati ' s tomb may be rebuilt following hc directions ] < / ref > however , after protests from citizens and literary class of city , who demanded to re - build the tomb , there are rumors that memorial may be re - built as per orders of [[ gujarat high court ]] . however , so far , the [[ government of gujarat ]] has shown no move in this direction . < ref > [ http : / / timesofindia . indiatimes . com / city / ahmedabad / wali - gujaratis - tomb - may - be - rebuilt - following - hc - directions / articleshow / 11830229 . cms ? referral = pm wali gujarati ' s tomb may be rebuilt following hc directions ] < / ref >
674932849 0 = = = 1946 bihar = = = in october 1946 , in bihar , between 7 , 000 and 8 , 000 people were killed in an anti - muslim riot . the hindu chief minister refused to allow british troops to fire on the rioters . no enquiry was held , and he ignored the complicity of members of the [[ indian national congress | congress ]] party who took part in the violence . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 10 }} {{ sfn | bihar }} {{ sfn | markovits }} this rioting was in retaliation to the [[ noakhali carnage ]] against hindus which , in turn , was a reaction against the atrocities of [[ direct action day ]] in [[ kolkata | calcutta ]] . {{ sfn | d ' costa | 2010 | p = 213 }}
675102250 0 = = depictions = = the film ' ' [[ parzania ]] ' ' , which is based on the [[ gulbarg society massacre ]] which occurred during the 2002 violence , was boycotted by [[ movie theater | cinemas ]] in gujarat over fear of sparking another riot . the film documents atrocities such as families being burned alive in their homes by hindu extremists , women being set on fire after being gang - raped , and children being hacked to pieces . the film has however been termed very one sided by most members of the india intelligentsia , including members of the muslim community . it takes one particualr event during the riots and cashes in on the emotions surrounding it . {{ sfn | chu | 2007 }} ' ' [[ final solution ( 2003 film ) | final solution ]] ' ' by [[ rakesh sharma ( film maker ) | rakesh sharma ]] is considered one of the better [[ documentary film | documentaries ]] which covers the violence in gujarat in 2002 . {{ sfn | gupta | 2013 | p = 372 }} the [[ central board of film certification ]] had tried to [[ censorship in india | ban ]] the film but , in 2004 , chairman [[ anupam kher ]] granted a certificate which allowed an uncut version to be screened . {{ sfn | mazzarella | 2013 | p = 224 }}
678584555 5 738 < / ref > statistics released by the indian government reveals that between 2011 - 2013 , congress ruled states had more number of communal violence incidents than bjp ruled states . samajwadi party - ruled uttar pradesh was the worst - hit when it comes to communal unrest . < ref name = " indiatoday . intoday . in " / > < ref > http : / / www . oneindia . com / feature / communal - riots - increasing - during - nda - 2 - regime - mha - report - de - 1498080 . html < / ref > < ref > http : / / www . dailymail . co . uk / indiahome / indianews / article - 2554821 / communal - violence - soars - according - government - figures - congress - states - worse - bjp - strongholds . html < / ref > < ref > http : / / www . firstpost . com / india / not - just - modi - guide - to - communal - riots - before - 2002 - and - after - 688714 . html < / ref > scholars fault
708616109 2 {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segments of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs form one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the male members and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims . }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 | ps = : " violence perpetrated against muslims is now naturalized : riots are ' well - known and accepted transgression of routine political behavior in india . ' . . . ' hindu - muslim riots and anti - muslim pogroms have been endemic in india since independence . ' " }}
710056388 6 . violence against women also included their being stripped naked , sharp objects being pierced into their bodies , acid attacks , beatings , cutting of breasts etc . muslim - owned shops , business centres , buildings and vehicles were destroyed , burnt and looted . coordinated attacks against muslims were carried out by extremist hindu mobs who drove to the sites of violence in large number in trucks . they used swords , petrol bombs , gas cylinders to destroy homes and businesses . children were killed by being burnt alive and speared
717249452 28 the riots started as a result of communal tension prevailing in the city after the [[ demolition of babri masjid | babri mosque demolition ]] on 6 december 1992 . the shrikrishna commission identified ' ' ' two phases ' ' ' to the riots . ' ' ' ' ' the first ' ' ' ' ' was mainly a muslim backlash as a result of the babri masjid demolition in the week immediately succeeding 6 december 1992 led by political leaders representing hindutva in the city of [[ ayodhya ]] . ' ' ' ' ' the second phase ' ' ' ' ' was a hindu backlash occurring as a result of the killings of hindu mathadi kamgar ( workers ) by muslim fanatics in dongri ( an area of south bombay ) , stabbing of hindus in muslim majority areas and burning of six hindus , including a physically handicapped girl in radhabai chawl . this phase occurred in january 1993 , with most incidents reported between 6 and 20 january . the report asserted that the communal passions of the hindus were aroused to fever pitch by the inciting writings in print media , particularly saamna and navaakal which gave exaggerated accounts of the mathadi murders and the radhabai chawl incident ; rumours were floated that there were imminent attacks by muslims using sophisticated arms , though the possibility of it happening was very imminent .
33 post - godhra anti - muslim violence spread like wildfire across gujarat and particularly large cities and towns like ahmedabad , surat , vadodara , rajkot , gandhinagar , halvad , jamnagar , naroda , himatnagar , ode , modasa , bharuch were mostly affected . there were instances of [[ rape in india | rape ]] , children being burned alive , and widespread looting and destruction of property . the chief minister at that time , [[ narendra modi ]] , has been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have police and government officials who allegedly directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to them . < ref name = " murphy 2011 " / >
34 coordinated attacks against muslims were carried out by extremist hindu mobs who drove to the sites of violence in large numbers in trucks . they used swords , guns , petrol bombs and gas cylinders to destroy homes and places of business . the attacks were made in full view of police stations and police officers ; however , the police did not intervene the rioters . < ref name = " murphy 2011 " / > the rioters used mobile phones to coordinate their attacks . < ref name = " khan 2011 b " / > by the end of the day on 28 february a curfew had been declared in 27 towns and cities across the state . < ref name = " oommen 2005 a " / > muslim - owned shops , business centres , buildings and vehicles were destroyed , burnt and looted . there was also widespread targeted destruction of shrines and mosques . the tomb of malik asin was bulldozed , and the [[ muhafiz khan mosque ]] was destroyed . the tomb of the eighteenth century saint [[ wali mohammed wali ]] was leveled and paved over the following day by the city municipal council . {{ clarify | which city would this be ? | date = april 2015 }} it is estimated that 230 [[ mosque | mosques ]] and 274 [[ dargah ]] s were destroyed , bulldozed and damaged
40 . violence against women also included their being stripped naked , sharp objects being forced into their bodies , acid attacks , cutting of breasts , slitting of stomachs and reproductive organs , beatings and then their being killed . it is estimated that at least 250 girls and women had been raped , [[ gang rape ]] d and then burned to death . children were killed by being burnt alive and those digging mass graves described the bodies as " burned and butchered beyond recognition " . children were force fed petrol and then set on fire , pregnant women were gutted and their unborn child ' s bodies were shown to them . in the naroda patiya mass grave of 96 bodies 46 were women . the murderers also flooded homes and electrocuted entire families inside . children and infants were killed by being burnt and speared
735916090 1 }} then chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215
739168422 1 }} then chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215
741426102 1 for example , research by raheel dhattiwala and michael biggs has stated that killings are far higher in areas where the bjp faces stiff electoral opposition than in areas in which it is already strong . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} in 1989 , the north of india saw an increase in orchestrated attacks on muslims , and the bjp had further success in the local and state elections . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} the [[ social anthropologist ]] [[ stanley jeyaraja tambiah ]] concludes that the violence in [[ bhagalpur ]] in [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | 1989 ]] , hashimpura in [[ hashimpura massacre | 1987 ]] and in [[ moradabad ]] [[ 1980 moradabad riots | 1980 ]] were organised killings . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 321 }} according to [[ ram puniyani ]] , the shiv sena were victorious in the elections due to the violence in the 1990s , and the bjp in gujarat after the 2002 violence . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} [[ gyan prakash ]] , however , cautions that the bjp ' s actions in gujarat do not equate to the entirety of india , and it remains to be seen if the [[ hindutva ]] movement has been successful in the deployment of this strategy nationwide . {{ sfn | prakash | 2007 | pp = 177 – 179 }}
748816788 10 the roots are thought to lie in india ' s history & nbsp ; – resentment toward the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | islamic domination ]] of india during the [[ middle ages ]] , policies established by the country ' s [[ british raj | british colonizers ]] , and the violent partition of india into an [[ islamic ]] [[ pakistan ]] and a secular india with a muslim minority . many scholars believe that incidents of anti - muslim violence are politically motivated and a part of the electoral strategy of mainstream political parties who are associated with [[ hindu nationalism ]] like the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] . other scholars believe that the violence is not widespread but that it is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions . < ref name = " atal2009 " > {{ cite book | author = yogesh atal | title = sociology and social anthropology in india | url = https : / / books . google wordpress
750039443 0 = = depictions = = the film ' ' [[ parzania ]] ' ' , which is based on the [[ gulbarg society massacre ]] which occurred during the 2002 violence , was boycotted by [[ movie theater | cinemas ]] in gujarat over fear of sparking another riot . the film documents atrocities such as families being burned alive in their homes by hindu extremists , women being set on fire after being gang - raped , and children being hacked to pieces . {{ sfn | chu | 2007 }} ' ' [[ final solution ( 2003 film ) | final solution ]] ' ' by [[ rakesh sharma ( filmmaker ) | rakesh sharma ]] is considered one of the better [[ documentary film | documentaries ]] which covers the violence in gujarat in 2002 . {{ sfn | gupta | 2013 | p = 372 }} the [[ central board of film certification ]] had tried to [[ censorship in india | ban ]] the film but , in 2004 , chairman [[ anupam kher ]] granted a certificate which allowed an uncut version to be screened . {{ sfn | mazzarella | 2013 | p = 224 }}
760289064 6 village called nellie . {{ sfn | hazarika | 1984 }} {{ sfn | s . b . | 2012 }} it has been described as one of the most severe massacre since [[ world war ii ]] with the majority of victims being women and children , as a result of the actions of the [[ assam movement ]] . {{ sfn | ghosh | 2004 | p = 312 }} {{ sfn | hussain | 2009 | p = 261 }} one reason cited for this incident is that it resulted from a build - up of resentment over immigration . {{ sfn | datta | 2012 | p = 183 }} the assam movement insisted on striking the names of [[ illegal immigration | illegal immigrants ]] from the electoral register and their deportation from the state . there was widespread support for the movement , which tapered off between 1981 and 1982 . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 481 }} the movement demanded that anyone who had entered the state illegally since 1951 be deported . the central government , however , insisted on a cutoff date of 1971 . towards the end of 1982 constituency
762027338 6 women being set on fire after being gang - raped , and children being hacked to pieces . {{ sfn | chu | 2007 }} ' ' [[ final solution ( 2003 film ) | final solution ]] ' ' by [[ rakesh sharma ( filmmaker ) | rakesh sharma ]] is considered one of the better [[ documentary film | documentaries ]] which covers the violence in gujarat in 2002 . {{ sfn | gupta | 2013 | p = 372 }} the [[ central board of film certification ]] had tried to [[ censorship in india | ban ]] the film but , in 2004 , chairman [[ anupam kher ]] granted a certificate which allowed an uncut version to be screened . {{ sfn | mazzarella | 2013 | p = 224 }}
774264448 0 = = role of political parties = = = m [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) . in particular , scholars fault the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) and the [[ shiv sena ]] for complicity in these incidents of violence {{ sfn | brass | a }} {{ sfn | brass | b }} {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} and of using violence against muslims as a part of a larger electoral strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 382 }} for example , research by raheel dhattiwala and michael biggs has stated that killings are far higher in areas where the bjp faces stiff electoral opposition than in areas in which it is already strong . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} in 1989 , the north of india saw an increase in orchestrated attacks on muslims , and the bjp had further success in the local and state elections . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} the [[ social anthropologist ]] [[ stanley jeyaraja tambiah ]] concludes that the violence in [[ bhagalpur ]] in [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | 1989 ]] , hashimpura in [[ hashimpura massacre | 1987 ]] and in [[ moradabad ]] [[ 1980 moradabad riots | 1980 ]] were organised killings . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 321 }} according to [[ ram puniyani ]] , the shiv sena were victorious in the elections due to the violence in the 1990s , and the bjp in gujarat after the 2002 violence . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} [[ gyan prakash ]] , however , cautions that the bjp ' s actions in gujarat do not equate to the entirety of india , and it remains to be seen if the [[ hindutva ]] movement has been successful in the deployment of this strategy nationwide . {{ sfn | prakash | 2007 | pp = 177 – 179 }}
783462863 0 = = others = = although muslims enjoy a minority status along with privileges of being granted preferred status in education and govt jobs , the same is not reciprocated in muslim majority contries for hindus . this has also caused resentment amongst hindus who are the majority taxpayers and receive next to nothing in comparison . < ref > [ http : / / http : / / www . hindustantimes . com / india - news / telangana - assembly - passes - bill - increasing - quota - for - muslims - scs - and - sts - to - 12 - state - s - total - quota - goes - above - sc - limit - of - 50 / story - zcarbkggr7f5nqnrq3jvni . html ] , reservation for muslims in schools and jobs - hindustan times report . < / ref >
784489182 0 although muslims enjoy a minority status along with privileges of being granted preferred status in education and govt jobs , the same is not reciprocated in muslim majority contries for hindus . this has also caused resentment amongst hindus who are the majority taxpayers and receive next to nothing in comparison . < ref > [ http : / / http : / / www . hindustantimes . com / india - news / telangana - assembly - passes - bill - increasing - quota - for - muslims - scs - and - sts - to - 12 - state - s - total - quota - goes - above - sc - limit - of - 50 / story - zcarbkggr7f5nqnrq3jvni . html ] , reservation for muslims in schools and jobs - hindustan times report . < / ref >
787214188 5 google . com / books ? id = yk _ cp3qiul4c & pg = pa161 | year = 2008 | publisher = harvard university press | isbn = 978 - 0 - 674 - 02776 - 3 | pages = 161 }} < / ref > the causes of this [[ violence against muslims ]] are varied . the roots are thought to lie in india ' s history & nbsp ; – resentment toward the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | islamic domination ]] of india during the [[ middle ages ]] , policies established by the country ' s [[ british raj | british colonizers ]] , and the violent partition of india into an [[ islamic ]] [[ pakistan ]] and a secular india with a muslim minority . many scholars believe that incidents of anti - muslim violence are politically motivated and a part of the electoral strategy of mainstream political parties who are associated with [[ hindu nationalism ]] like the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] . other scholars believe that the violence is not widespread but that it is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions . < ref name = " atal2009 " > {{ cite book | author = yogesh atal | title = sociology and social anthropology in india | url = https : / / books . google . com / books ? id = 1z2e1q1jlvsc & pg = pa241 | year = 2009 | publisher = pearson education india | isbn = 978 - 81 - 317 - 2034 - 9 | pages = 250 – 251 }} < / ref >
810403693 0 = = = demographics = = = the bjp politicians , as well as those of other parties , argue that [[ demographics ]] play an essential role in indian elections . the bjp believe that the higher the number of muslims within a constituency , the higher are the chances of centrist parties to acquiesce to minority groups ' requests , which lowers the chances of muslims " building bridges " with their hindu neighbours . as such , according to this argument " muslim appeasement " is the root cause of communal violence . {{ sfn | varshney | 2003 | p = 8 }} susanne and lloyd rudolph argue that the economic disparity is a reason for the aggression shown towards muslims by hindus . as india ' s economy expanded due to [[ globalization ]] and [[ investment ]] from overseas companies , the expectations of the hindu population were not matched by the opportunities . hindu nationalists then encouraged the perception of muslims as the source of the hindus ' troubles . {{ sfn | price | 2012 | p = 95 }} the actions of anti - hindu and [[ insurgency in jammu and kashmir | anti - india militant groups ]] in [[ kashmir conflict | kashmir ]] and pakistan have reinforced anti - muslim feelings in india , which has strengthened the hindu right . the [[ hindutva ]] discourse portrays muslims as traitors and state enemies , whose patriotism is suspected . {{ sfn | sikand | 2006 | p = 88 }} [[ sumit ganguly ]] argues that the rise in terrorism cannot only be attributed to [[ socioeconomics | socioeconomic ]] factors , but also to the violence perpetrated by hindutva forces . {{ sfn | ganguly | 2003 | p = 10 }}
812875363 0 = = = role of political parties = = = many social scientists feel that many of these acts of violence are institutionally supported , particularly by political parties and organizations connected to the [[ hindu nationalism | hindu nationalist ]] volunteer organisation , [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) . in particular , scholars fault the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) and the [[ shiv sena ]] for complicity in these incidents of violence {{ sfn | brass | a }} {{ sfn | brass | b }} {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} and of using violence against muslims as a part of a larger electoral strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 382 }} for example , research by raheel dhattiwala and michael biggs has stated that killings are far higher in areas where the bjp faces stiff electoral opposition than in areas in which it is already strong . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} in 1989 , the north of india saw an increase in orchestrated attacks on muslims , and the bjp had further success in the local and state elections . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} the [[ social anthropologist ]] [[ stanley jeyaraja tambiah ]] concludes that the violence in [[ bhagalpur ]] in [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | 1989 ]] , hashimpura in [[ hashimpura massacre | 1987 ]] and in [[ moradabad ]] [[ 1980 moradabad riots | 1980 ]] were organised killings . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 321 }} according to [[ ram puniyani ]] , the shiv sena were victorious in the elections due to the violence in the 1990s , and the bjp in gujarat after the 2002 violence . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} [[ gyan prakash ]] , however , cautions that the bjp ' s actions in gujarat do not equate to the entirety of india , and it remains to be seen if the [[ hindutva ]] movement has been successful in the deployment of this strategy nationwide . {{ sfn | prakash | 2007 | pp = 177 – 179 }}
816103315 0 = = = 2002 gujarat violence = = = {{ main article | 2002 gujarat violence }} since partition , muslim community has been subject to and engaged in sectarian violence in [[ gujarat ]] . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} in [[ 2002 gujarat violence | 2002 ]] , in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror , " {{ sfn | singh | 2010 | p = 348 }} hindu [[ extremism | extremists ]] carried out acts of violence against the muslim minority population , in retaliation to on going sectarian violence and persecution by radicalised islamists , often backed by the pakistan intelligence services , with increasing support amongst the local muslim population .
845514534 0 = = = 2013 muzaffarnagar riots = = = {{ main | 2013 muzaffarnagar riots }} the clashes between the hindu and muslim communities in muzaffarnagar district of uttar pradesh , india in august – september 2013 , resulted in at least 62 deaths including 42 muslims and 20 hindus and injured 93 and left more than 50 , 000 displaced . it was reported on 15 november 2013 that a total of 13 rape and sexual harassment cases were registered over the past two months of rioting and the report named 111 people in the incidents but no arrests had been made till then .
849847987 0 = = = 1964 kolkata = = = riots between [[ hindu ]] s and [[ muslim ]] s had left over a hundred people dead , 438 people were injured . over 7000 people were arrested . 70 , 000 muslims have fled their homes and 55 , 000 were provided protection by the [[ indian army ]] . muslims in kolkata became more ghettoized than ever before in the aftermath of this riot . the riot was believed to be instigated by violence against hindus in [[ east pakistan ]] ( now bangladesh ) and the flow of refugees from there . violence was also seen in rural [[ west bengal ]] . < ref > {{ cite web | title = 1964 : riots in calcutta leave more than 100 dead | url = http : / / news . bbc . co . uk / onthisday / hi / dates / stories / january / 13 / newsid _ 4098000 / 4098363 . stm | website = news . bbc . co . uk | publisher = british broadcasting corporation | accessdate = 7 july 2015 }} < / ref >
849934096 0 = = = 1969 to 1989 = = = during the [[ 1969 gujarat riots ]] , it is estimated that 630 people lost their lives . {{ sfn | khalidi | 2009 | p = 180 }} the [[ 1970 bhiwandi riots ]] was an instance of anti - muslim violence which occurred between 7 and 8 may in the indian towns of bhiwandi , jalgaon and mahad . there were large amounts of arson and vandalism of muslim - owned properties . in 1980 in moradabad , an estimated 2 , 500 people were killed . the official estimate is 400 and other observers estimate between 1 , 500 and 2 , 000 . local police were directly implicated in planning the violence . {{ sfn | engineer | 1991 | p = 209 }} in 1989 in bhagalpur , it is estimated nearly 1 , 000 people lost their lives in violent attacks , {{ sfn | khalidi | 2009 | p = 180 }} believed to be a result of tensions raised over the [[ ayodhya dispute ]] and the processions carried out by vhp activists , which were to be a show of strength and to serve as a warning to the minority communities . {{ sfn | berglund | 2011 | p = 105 }}

559540497 34 their founding in 1925 . < ref name = sarkur > {{ cite book | last = sarkur | first = tanika | title = women and the politics of violence | year = 2007 | publisher = har anand | isbn = 978 - 8124108475 | page = 187 | editor = taisha abraham }} < / ref >
57 pogram one reason given for anti muslim violence is the ill will which is still prevalent after the violence during the [[ partition of india ]] . muslims are viewed as suspect and their loyalty to the state is questioned . this tension will at times explode into mass violence against the muslim population . < ref name = hefner > {{ cite book | last = hefner | first = robert w . | title = schooling islam : the culture and politics of modern muslim education | year = 2006 | publisher = princeton university press | isbn = 978 - 0691129334 | page = 23 | editor = robert w . hefner , muhammad qasim zaman }} < / ref > according to khalidi < blockquote > anti - muslim violence is planned and executed to render muslims economically and socially crippled and , as a final outcome of that economic and social backwardness , assimilating them into lower rungs of hindu society . < ref name = puniyan > {{ cite book | last = puniyan | first = ram | title = communal politics : facts versus myths | year = 2003 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0761996675 | page = 153 }} < / ref >
58 [[ cultural nationalism ]] has also been given as a reason for instances of violence carried out by [[ shiv sena ]] , a fascist political party . they initially claimed to speak for the people of maharashtra but their rhetoric quickly turned to inciting violence against muslims . they were complicit in the violence in 1984 in the town of bhiwandi and again in the violence in bombay in 1992 and 1993 . in both of these instances sena had help from the police and local officials . violence has been incited by sena in 1971 and 1986 .
72 estimates 5000 , with the majority being women and children as a result of actions undertaken by the [[ assam movement ]] . < ref name = ghosh > {{ cite book | last = ghosh | first = partha s . | title = peace studies : an introduction to the concept , scope , and themes | year = 2004 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0761996606 | page = 312 | editor = ranabir samaddar | date = | month = }} < / ref >

95 a pogrom in gujarat in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror " < ref name = singh > {{ cite book | last = singh | first = sujala | title = terror and the postcolonial : a concise companion | year = 2009 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405191548 | page = 248 | editor = elleke boehmer , stephen morton | quote = one of the most horrific instances of fascistic state terror took place in gujarat in 2002 }} < / ref >
109 pogrom in february 2002 [[ tehelka ]] released [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ( tehelka report ) | the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] which implicated the state government in the violence and that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was in reality a state sanctioned pogrom . < ref name = risam > {{ cite book | last = risam | first = roopika | title = encyclopedia of social movement media | year = 2010 | publisher = sage | isbn = 978 - 0761926887 | page = 521 | editor = john d . h . downing | date = 30 | month = december }} < / ref > according to [[ human rights watch ]] the violence in gujarat in 2002 was preplanned and the police and state government participated in the violence . < ref name = narula > {{ cite news | last = narula | first = smita | title = india : gujarat officials took part in anti - muslim violence | publisher = human rights watch | date = 1 may , 2002 | quote = not a spontaneous uprising , it was a carefully orchestrated attack against muslims . the attacks were planned in advance and organized with extensive participation of the police and state government officials }} < / ref >
561368412 2 in 2012 modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community are reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief " and teesta setalvad of ngo , citizen for peace and justice has said the legal fight was not yet over as they had the right to appeal . < ref name = krishnan > {{ cite news | last = krishnan | first = murali | title = modi ' s clearance in the gujarat riots case angers indian muslims | url = http : / / www . dw . de / modis - clearance - in - the - gujarat - riots - case - angers - indian - muslims / a - 15874606 | newspaper = deutsche welle | date = 11 march , 2012 | author2 = shamil shams }} < / ref >
561415360 0 death toll figures range from the official estimate of 790 muslims and 254 hindus killed to 2000 muslims killed . < ref name = campbell > {{ cite book | last = campbell | first = john | title = the routledge handbook of religion and security | year = 2012 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0415667449 | page = 233 | editor = chris seiple , dennis hoover , dennis r . hoover , pauletta otis }} < / ref >
561419515 0 brass has given an example of police actions in [[ uttar pradesh ]] where he says that the state itself is not institutionalised as anti - muslim , nor are the police . their actions or inactions depend on who is in power at the time , and that though some officers will act according to their beliefs their actions are constrained by those with political power . < ref name = brass5 > {{ cite book | last = brass | first = paul r . | title = the production of hindu - muslim violence in contemporary india | year = 2005 | publisher = university of washington press | isbn = 978 - 0295985060 | page = 328 }} < / ref >

561434839 0 in 1980 in moradabad it is estimated that up to 2500 people were killed , the official estimate is 400 and other observers estimate between 1500 and 2000 . local police were directly implicated in planning the violence . < ref name = engineer > {{ cite book | last = engineer | first = asghar ali | title = communal riots in post - independence india | year = 1991 | publisher = sangam | isbn = 978 - 0863111396 | page = 209 }} < / ref >
561528780 0 ashutosh varshney believes that the violence is not as endemic as it appears as it is usually contained to urban areas and that rural communities which account for two thirds of the population only accounted for four percent of deaths in instances of mass violence . < ref name = varshney > {{ cite web | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = understanding gujarat violence | url = http : / / conconflicts . ssrc . org / archives / gujarat / varshney / | publisher = social science research council }} < / ref >

561853635 0 agnihotri & ray points out that in 1983 ahead of assam assembly election [[ indira gandhi ]] visited assam with her visit particularly confined to old cachar which is predominantly inhabited by illegal immigrants to secure the muslim votes . < ref name = " agnihotriray2002 " > {{ cite book | author1 = s . k . agnihotri | author2 = b . datta ray | title = perspective of security and development in north east india | url = http : / / books . google . com / books ? id = okriqahwkjcc & pg = pa106 | accessdate = 28 june 2013 | year = 2002 | publisher = concept publishing company | isbn = 978 - 81 - 8069 - 165 - 2 | pages = 106 – }} < / ref >
561862110 0 the assam movement insisted on the striking of the names of illegal immigrants from the electoral register and the deportation of all illegals from the state . there was widespread support for the movement although this support tapered off between 1981 and 1982 . the movement insisted that anyone who had entered the state illegally since 1951 be deported , the central government however insisted on a cutoff date of 1971 . towards the end of 1982 the central government called elections and the movement called for people to boycott it , which lead to violence . < ref name = chatterji > {{ cite book | last = chatterji | first = joya | title = the bangladesh reader : history , culture , politics | year = 2013 | publisher = duke university press | isbn = 978 - 0822353188 | page = 418 | editor = meghna guhathakurta , willem van schende }} < / ref >

562124776 0 human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , dalits and tribals who tried to protect muslims from the violence . < ref name = " heroism " / >
1 < ref name = " heroism " > {{ cite web | last = watch | first = h r . | title = compounding injustice : the government ' s failure to redress massacres in gujarat | year = 2003 | publisher = fédération internationale des droits de l ' homme | page = 57 | url = http : / / www . hrw . org / reports / 2003 / 06 / 30 / compounding - injustice }} < / ref >
563493972 0 the rss carried out acts of violence against muslims when founded in 1925 , < ref name = " sarkur " / > and have since , formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india . < ref name = " breker " / >
563523360 2 < ref > the term " communalist riot " covers not just violence by hindus against muslims but all sectarian violence in south asia , such as intergroup violence between muslims , hindus , sikhas and christians < / ref >
563529586 1 2002 . gujarat riots in the light of the history of communal violence . economic and political weekly , vol . 37 , no . 50 ( dec . 14 - 20 , 2002 ) , pp . 5047 - 5054 < / ref > .
563530865 2 and since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , < ref > christophe jaffrelot . 1999 . the hindu nationalist movement and indian politics : 1925 to the 1990s : strategies of identity - building , implantation and mobilisation ( with special reference to central india . penguin books india , p . 39 - 40 < / ref >
563546864 0 the bjp as well as other politicians argue that demographics play an essential role in indian elections . the bjp believe that the higher the number of muslims within a constituency then , the higher are the chances of parties from the center to agree with minority groups requests , which lowers the chances of muslims " building bridges " with their hindu neighbors , as such according to this argument " muslim appeasement " is the root cause of communal violence . < ref name = " varshney 2003 " > {{ cite book | last = varshney | first = ashutosh | title = ethnic conflict and civic life : hindus and muslims in india | year = 2003 | publisher = yale university press | isbn = 978 - 0300100136 | page = 8 | edition = 2nd revised }} < / ref >
563842921 2 > several scholars have likewise concluded that the riots must have been pre - planned , and that hindu rioters had been given acces to information about the locations of muslim homes and businesses from non - public sources . < ref > chris ogden . 2012 a lasting legacy : the bjp - led national democratic alliance and india ' s politics journal of contemporary asia . vol . 42 , iss . 1 , 2012 < / ref
563846305 0 > famed indian author [[ arundhati roy ]] also published the essay " fascism ' s firm footprint in india " in the nation arguing that the attack had been a " meticulously planned pogrom " . < ref > arundhati roy . 2002 . fascism ’ s firm footprint in india 30 september 2002 . the nation [ http : / / www . xtome . org / docs / countries / india / ar093002 . pdf ] < / ref
564552469 0 susanne and lloyd rudolph argue that economic disparity is a reason for the aggression shown towards muslims by hindus . as india ' s economy expanded due to globalization and investment from overseas companies the expectations of the hindu population were not matched by opportunities . hindu nationalists then encouraged this perception which leads the hindus to view muslims as the source of their troubles . < ref name = " price 2012 p95 " / >
1 < ref name = " price 2012 p95 " > {{ cite book | last = price | first = daniel e . | title = sacred terror : how faith becomes lethal | year = 2012 | publisher = praeger | isbn = 978 - 0313386381 | page = 95 }}
564578564 0 elaisha nandrajog argues that the violence in gujarat in 2002 was inevitable as the state government had replaced history and political science textbooks with material written by the rss . and that this " communal indoctrination " over twenty years had made young people willing subjects of the state . < ref name = " nandrajog 2010 " / >

564784625 0 the actions of anti - hindu and anti - india militant groups in [[ kashmir conflict | kashmir ]] and pakistan have reinforced anti - muslim feelings in india , which has strengthened the hindu right . the hindutva discourse portrays muslims as traitors and state enemies , whose patriotism is suspected . < ref name = " sikand 2006 p88 " / > [[ sumit ganguly ]] argues that the rise in terrorism can not only be attributed to socioeconomic factors , but also to the violence perpetrated by hindutva forces . < ref name = " ganguly 2003 p10 " / >
1 < ref name = " sikand 2006 p88 " > {{ cite book | last = sikand | first = yoginder | title = the blackwell companion to contemporary islamic thought | year = 2006 | publisher = wiley - blackwell | isbn = 978 - 1405121743 | page = 88 | editor = ibrahim abu - rabi ' | quote = in the fascist hindutva imagination , the indian muslims are continuously reviled as pakistani " fifth columnists , " as " enemies of the nation " and so on , and their patriotism is said to be suspect . the muslim as the menacing " other " occupies a central place in hindutva discourse , and this has been used to legitimize large - scale anti - muslim violence . }} < / ref > < ref name = " ganguly 2003 p10 " > {{ cite book | last = ganguly | first = sumit | title = the kashmir question : retrospect and prospect | year = 2003 | publisher = routledge | isbn = 978 - 0714684390 | page = 10 }} < / ref >
566197025 0 hindu right wing politicians will often legitimize instances of mass violence against muslims as a natural reaction to actions perpetrated by muslims in the past and the present . however the patterns of mass violence such as these events have been well established since partition with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . < ref name = " pennington 2012 p32 " / >
1 < ref name = " pennington 2012 p32 " > {{ cite book | last = pennington | first = brian k . | title = teaching religion and violence | year = 2012 | publisher = oxford university press | isbn = 978 - 0195372427 | page = 32 | editor = brian k . pennington }} < / ref >
566751669 0 the massacre stands as a testament that the [[ all assam students union ]] ( aasu ) had left behind the economic reasons for the protests and the non violent methods they had employed up until then , and that they had become influenced by religious politics . the aasu denied any involvement in the massacre and ensured that there were no further instances of organized violence after the incident at nellie , and since then there have been no instances of communal violence in upper assam . < ref name = " saikia 2005 p65 " / >
1 < ref name = " saikia 2005 p65 " > {{ cite book | last = saikia | first = yasmin | title = fragmented memories : struggling to be tai - ahom in india | year = 2005 | publisher = duke university press | isbn = 978 - 0822333739 | page = 65 }} < / ref >
566973685 1 < ref name = " dhattiwala 2012 pp483 – 516 " > {{ cite journal | last = dhattiwala | first = raheel | coauthors = michael biggs | title = the political logic of ethnic violence : the anti - muslim pogrom in gujarat , 2002 | journal = politics & society | year = 2012 | volume = 40 | issue = 4 | pages = 483 – 516 | doi = 10 . 1177 / 0032329212461125 }} < / ref >
568326070 0 according to official figures there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and that between 1968 and 1980 there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . < ref name = " brass 2005 p = 60 " / >
1 < ref name = " brass 2005 p = 60 " > {{ cite book | last = brass | first = paul r . | title = the production of hindu - muslim violence in contemporary india | year = 2005 | publisher = university of washington press | isbn = 978 - 0295985060 | page = 328 }} < / ref >
575477268 0 according to [[ political science | political scientists ]] , organizations with roots in [[ hindu nationalism ]] have played a large part in these incidents of anti - muslim violence , and in generating anti - muslim sentiment . in particular , organizations associated with the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] , such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] , [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] and [[ bajrang dal ]] are all considered by scholars to have a central role in the violence . the bjp , and its predecessor the [[ jana sangh ]] , have used these communal riots and anti - muslim [[ propaganda ]] as a part of a larger political strategy . these incidents of violence against muslims have marred india ’ s post independence history with a spill - over effect on india ’ s cause in the [[ kashmir conflict ]] .

584508070 0 hinduism hindus against muslims and , since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 1996 | p = ? }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} it has formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india
585582943 0 = = = 2013 muzaffarnagar riots = = = beginning on 27 august 2013 , clashes between the hindu and muslim communities of the muzaffarnagar district , uttar pradesh , india have claimed 43 lives and injured 93 . [ 6 ] [ 7 ] [ 8 ] [ 9 ] as of 17 september , the curfew has been removed from all riot affected areas and the army was also withdrawn . [ 10 ] the attacks have been described as " the worst violence in up in recent memory , " with the army , as a result , being deployed in the state for the first time in 20 years . [ 11 ]

599161780 0 moreover , the muslims in india do not live in fear , the way minorities in pakistan live , as the indian government has implemented many welfare schemes for muslims , like ( a ) reservation in education and government jobs , ( b ) 20 % reservation for muslims in the police force , wherever muslims are more than 20 % of the population ( deemed communally sensitive areas ) , ( c ) rs . 50 , 000 / - dowry ( bidaai ) to muslim girls at the time of their marriage , ( d ) implementation of the recommendations of the [[ sachar committee report | sachar committee ]] and so on and muslims are pampered as a part of vote bank politics in india .
599729692 0 moreover , the government of india has implemented almost all the recommendations of the [[ sachar committee ]] to help muslims . < ref > {{ cite web | url = http : / / pib . nic . in / newsite / erelease . aspx ? relid = 50202 | title = implementation of sachar committee recommendations | date = 13 july 2009 | website = http : / / pib . nic . in / newsite / mainpage . aspx | publisher = press information bureau , government of india | accessdate = 17 march 2014 }} < / ref > < ref > {{ cite web | url = http : / / www . minorityaffairs . gov . in / sachar | title = sachar committee report | date = 5 march 2014 | website = http : / / www . minorityaffairs . gov . in | publisher = ministry of minority affairs , government of india | accessdate = 17 march 2014 }} < / ref >
603486787 1 6 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segnents of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs form one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the malemembers and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims .

115 < ref name = brass4 > {{ cite book | last = brass | first = paul r . | title = the production of hindu - muslim violence in contemporary india | year = 2005 | publisher = university of washington press | isbn = 978 - 0295985060 | page = 388 }} < / ref >
608667294 9 > {{ cite book | last = kaur | first = raminder | title = performative politics and the cultures of hinduism : public uses of religion in western india | year = 2005 | publisher = anthem | isbn = 978 - 1843311393 | page = 160 }} < / ref > in 1989 there were pogroms throughout the north of india . < ref name = chandavarkar2 > {{ cite book | last = chandavarkar | first = rajnayaran | title = history , culture and the indian city | year = 2009 | publisher = cambridge university press | isbn = 978 - 0521768719 | page = 29 | edition = 1st }} < / ref > | 2012 | p = 2 }} others argue that , although their community faces discrimination and violence , some muslims have been highly successful , {{ sfn | metcalf | 2013 | p = 109 }} that the violence is not as widespread as it appears , but is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions , and there are many cities where muslims and hindus live peacefully together with almost no incidences of sectarian violence . {{ sfn | varshney }} according to [[ political science | political scientists ]] , organizations with roots in [[ hindu nationalism ]] have played a large part in
21 pogroms the bjp , and its predecessor the [[ jana sangh ]] , have used these communal riots and anti - muslim [[ propaganda ]] as a part of a larger political strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} these incidents of violence against muslims have marred india ’ s post independence history with a spill - over effect on india ’ s cause in the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . hindu [[ right - wing politics | right - wing ]] politicians will often legitimize instances of mass violence against muslims as a natural reaction to actions perpetrated by muslims in the past and the present . however , these patterns of violence have been well - established since partition , with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . {{ sfn | pennington | 2012 | p = 32 }} over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 60 }}
22 < ref name = {{ location map + | india | float = right | width = 400 | caption = location of incidents . city name with year | places = {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' ahmedabad ' ' ' <
