id
584943519 0 ' ' ' anti - muslim violence in india ' ' ' has occurred periodically since the country ' s [[ partition of india | partition ]] in 1947 , frequently in the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 6 }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 }} such attacks , often referred to as " [[ communalism ( south asia ) | communal riots ]] " in [[ india ]] , are part of a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the hindu and muslim communities , which has been connected to a rise in anti - muslim sentiment throughout the 20th century . {{ sfn | herman | 2006 | p = 65 }} most incidents have occurred in the northern and western states of india , whereas communalist sentiment in the south is less pronounced . {{ sfn | cohen | 2013 | p = 66 }} among the largest incidents were [[ bihar ]] in 1946 , {{ sfn | riddick | 2006 | p = 118 }} [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] in 1983 {{ sfn | ganguly | 2007 | p = 135 }} and [[ 2002 gujarat violence | gujarat ]] in 2002 . {{ sfn | engineer | 2002 | pp = 5047 - 5054 }} the roots of this violence lie in india ' s history , stemming from lingering resentment toward the [[ islam ]] ic domination of india during the [[ middle ages ]] , policies established by the country ' s british colonizers , the violent partition of india into an islamic [[ pakistan ]] , and a secular india with a large but minority muslim population . {{ sfn | smith | 2005 | pp = 11 – 12 }} many scholars have described incidents of anti - muslim violence as politically motivated and organized , preferring to call them [[ pogrom ]] s {{ sfn | metcalf | 2009 | p = 117 }} or acts of [[ genocide ]] , {{ sfn | holt | 1977 | p = 117 }} {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 126 }} rather than mere " [[ riot ]] s " . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} others argue that , although their community faces discrimination and violence , some muslims have been highly successful , {{ sfn | metcalf | 2013 | p = 109 }} that the violence is not as widespread as it appears , but is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions , and there are many cities where muslims and hindus live peacefully together with almost no incidences of sectarian violence . {{ sfn | varshney }} according to [[ political science | political scientists ]] , organizations with roots in [[ hindu nationalism ]] have played a large part in these incidents of anti - muslim violence , and in generating anti - muslim sentiment . in particular , organizations associated with the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] , such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] , [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] and [[ bajrang dal ]] are all considered by scholars to have a central role in the violence . the bjp , and its predecessor the [[ jana sangh ]] , have used these communal riots and anti - muslim [[ propaganda ]] as a part of a larger political strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} these incidents of violence against muslims have marred india ’ s post independence history with a spill - over effect on india ’ s cause in the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . hindu [[ right - wing politics | right - wing ]] politicians will often legitimize instances of mass violence against muslims as a natural reaction to actions perpetrated by muslims in the past and the present . however , these patterns of violence have been well - established since partition , with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . {{ sfn | pennington | 2012 | p = 32 }} over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 60 }} = = causes and effects = = {{ location map + | india | float = right | width = 400 | caption = location of incidents . city name with year | places = {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' ahmedabad ' ' ' < br > ( 1969 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = topleft | lat = 23 . 03 | long = 72 . 58 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' bihar ' ' ' < br > ( 1946 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = left | lat = 24 . 783333 | long = 85 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' nellie ' ' ' < br > ( 1983 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = bottom | lat = 26 . 133 | long = 92 . 312 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' bhagalpur ' ' ' < br > ( 1989 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = bottom | lat = 25 . 1500 | long = 87 . 0200 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' ayodhya ' ' ' < br > ( 1992 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = left | lat = 26 . 80 | long = 82 . 20 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' moradabad ' ' ' < br > ( 1980 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = left | lat = 28 . 83 | long = 78 . 78 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' mumbai ' ' ' < br > ( 1992 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = right | lat = 18 . 975 | long = 72 . 825833 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' gujarat ' ' ' < br > ( 2002 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = left | lat = 23 | long = 72 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' bhiwandi ' ' ' < br > ( 1984 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = left | lat = 19 . 296 | long = 73 . 063 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' meerut ' ' ' < br > ( 1982 , 1987 ) | mark = red _ pog . svg | position = farright | lat = 28 . 99 | long = 77 . 70 }} }} these incidents have been described by [[ gyanendra pandey ( historian ) | gyanendra pandey ]] as a new form of [[ state terrorism ]] , stating that these are not " riots " but " organized political massacres " . {{ sfn | pandey | 2005 | p = 188 }} in 1989 , there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} according to [[ stanley jeyaraja tambiah ]] , the violence in [[ bhagalpur ]] in [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | 1989 ]] , hashimpura in [[ hashimpura massacre | 1987 ]] and in [[ moradabad ]] [[ 1980 moradabad riots | 1980 ]] were organised killings . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 321 }} [[ praveen swami ]] believes these periodic acts of violence have " scarred india ' s post independence history " and have also hindered india ' s cause in [[ jammu and kashmir ]] . {{ sfn | swami | 2006 | p = 217 }} = = = institutionalized riot systems = = = according to research by political scientist [[ paul brass ]] , though these acts of violence are usually referred to as " riots , " they habitually become [[ massacre ]] s of muslims and pogroms with relatively few hindus being killed . {{ sfn | brass | 2004 }} brass argues that , in affected areas , there are " institutionalized riot systems , in which the organizations of militant [[ hindu nationalism ]] are deeply implicated " . {{ sfn | brass | a }} his research also shows that those organizations that are a part of the [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) — such as the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) , the [[ vishwa hindu parishad ]] ( vhp ) and the [[ bajrang dal ]] — all have a central role in the violence . {{ sfn | brass | b }} when it was founded in 1925 , the rss saw itself as having the role of protecting hindus against muslims and , since its first involvement in hindu / muslim confrontations in the [[ 1927 nagpur riots ]] , {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 1996 | p = ? }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} it has formed militant groups who engage in attacks on minority groups throughout india . {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} = = = police actions = = = brass gives an example of [[ police action ]] s in [[ uttar pradesh ]] where the state itself is not [[ institutional racism | institutionalised ]] as anti - muslim , nor are the police . their actions or inactions depend on who is in power at the time and , though some officers will act according to their beliefs , their actions are constrained by those with political power . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 328 }} french political scientist [[ christophe jaffrelot ]] said that some of these incidents are a result of an electoral strategy by the bjp . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 382 }} according to research by raheel dhattiwala and michael biggs , killings are far higher in areas where the bjp face stiff electoral opposition than in areas in which they are already strong . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} in 1989 , the north of india saw an increase in orchestrated attacks on muslims , and the bjp had further success in the local and state elections . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} [[ gyan prakash ]] has cautioned that the bjp actions in gujarat does not equate to the entirety of india , and it remains to be seen if the [[ hindutva ]] movement is successful in deployment of this strategy nationwide . {{ sfn | prakash | 2007 | pp = 177 – 179 }} [[ ram puniyani ]] says that those who carry out these attacks are portrayed as " heroes " who have defended the majority from " anti - nationals " . he also says that thackery and shiv sena were victorious in the elections due to the violence in the 1990s , as was modi after the 2002 violence . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} one reason given for anti - muslim violence is the ill will , which is still prevalent after the violence during partition . muslims are viewed as suspect and their loyalty to the state is questioned . this tension will at times explode into mass violence against the muslim population . {{ sfn | hefner | 2006 | p = 23 }} according to [[ omar khalidi ]] : < blockquote > anti - muslim violence is planned and executed to render muslims economically and socially crippled and , as a final outcome of that economic and social backwardness , assimilating them into lower rungs of hindu society . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | p = 153 }} < / blockquote > = = = cultural nationalism = = = [[ cultural nationalism ]] has also been given as a reason for instances of violence carried out by [[ shiv sena ]] , a [[ fascism | fascist ]] political party . they initially claimed to speak for the people of [[ maharashtra ]] , but their [[ rhetoric ]] quickly turned to inciting violence against muslims . they were complicit in the violence in 1984 in the town of [[ bhiwandi ]] , and again in the violence in [[ mumbai | bombay ]] in 1992 and 1993 . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} in both of these instances , sena had help from the police and local officials . violence has been incited by sena in 1971 and 1986 . {{ sfn | kaur | 2005 | p = 160 }} {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} according to [[ sudipta kaviraj ]] the vhp are still engaged in the religious conflicts which began in medieval times . {{ sfn | kaviraj | 2010 | p = 245 }} another reason given for these outbreaks of violence is the upward mobility of the [[ caste system in india | lower castes ]] caused by the expansion of the economy . the violence has become a substitute for class tensions . nationalists , rather than deal with the claims from the lower class , instead view muslims and christians as not " fully indian " due to their religion . {{ sfn | metcalf | 2006 | p = 89 }} hindu nationalists also use the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | subjugation ]] of india by muslims as an excuse for violence . their view is that these conquerors had raped hindu women and destroyed places of worship . they feel that , since partition , the muslims are allied to pakistan and are possible terrorists and , therefore , the hindus must take revenge for these past wrongs and reassert their pride . {{ sfn | etzion | 2008 | pp = 123 – 124 }} the higher fertility rate among muslims has been a recurring theme in the hindu rights rhetoric . they claim that the [[ islam in india # population growth rate | higher ]] birth rate amongst muslims is part of a plan to turn the hindus into a minority within their own country . {{ sfn | weigl | 2012 | p = 19 }} jaffrelot has said that modi , in his election campaign following the violence in 2002 in gujarat , referred to the higher birth rate of muslims which is " something hindus fear " . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 384 }} [[ file : calcutta 1946 riot . jpg | left | thumb | 300px | dead and wounded after the ' direct action day ' which developed into pitched battles as muslim and hindu mobs rioted across [[ calcutta ]] in 1946 , the year before independence ]] after the violence in 2002 , the [[ parliament of india | indian parliament ]] introduced the communal violence ( prevention , control and rehabilitation of victims ) bill in 2005 . the bill was heavily criticised by [[ human rights ]] groups and lawyers . {{ sfn | times of india | 2005 }} a direct result of this violence has been a massive decrease in [[ dalits ]] converting to islam . {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 121 }} anti - muslim violence creates a security risk for hindus residing outside of india . since the 1950s , there have been retaliatory attacks on hindus in pakistan and [[ bangladesh ]] in response to anti - muslim violence , after the 1992 violence hindu temples were attacked in [[ great britain | britain ]] , [[ dubai ]] and [[ thailand ]] . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 16 }} this recurring violence has become a rigidly conventional pattern which has created a divide between the muslim and hindu communities . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 187 }} [[ jamaat - e - islami hind ]] has spoken out against these communal clashes , as it believes that the violence not only impacts upon muslims , but on india as a whole , and that these riots are damaging to progress . {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 86 }} in gujarat , the [[ terrorist and disruptive activities ( prevention ) act ]] ( tada ) was used in incidents pertaining to communal violence in 1992 and 1993 . the majority of those arrested under the act were muslim . conversely , tada was not used after the violence carried out against muslims during the [[ bombay riots ]] . {{ sfn | singh | 2012 | p = 427 }} = = = demographics = = = the bjp , as well as other politicians , argue that [[ demographics ]] play an essential role in indian elections . the bjp believe that the higher the number of muslims within a constituency , the higher are the chances of parties from the center to agree with minority groups ' requests , which lowers the chances of muslims " building bridges " with their hindu neighbors . as such , according to this argument " muslim appeasement " is the root cause of communal violence . {{ sfn | varshney | 2003 | p = 8 }} susanne and lloyd rudolph argue that economic disparity is a reason for the aggression shown towards muslims by hindus . as india ' s economy expanded due to [[ globalization ]] and [[ investment ]] from overseas companies , the expectations of the hindu population were not matched by opportunities . hindu nationalists then encouraged this perception , which leads the hindus to view muslims as the source of their troubles . {{ sfn | price | 2012 | p = 95 }} the actions of anti - hindu and anti - india militant groups in [[ kashmir conflict | kashmir ]] and pakistan have reinforced anti - muslim feelings in india , which has strengthened the hindu right ( hindutva ) . the hindutva discourse portrays muslims as traitors and state enemies , whose patriotism is suspected . {{ sfn | sikand | 2006 | p = 88 }} [[ sumit ganguly ]] argues that the rise in terrorism cannot only be attributed to [[ socioeconomics | socioeconomic ]] factors , but also to the violence perpetrated by hindutva forces . {{ sfn | ganguly | 2003 | p = 10 }} = = major incidents = = in october 1946 , in bihar , between 7 , 000 and 8 , 000 people were killed in an anti - muslim riot . the hindu chief minister refused to allow british troops to fire on the rioters . no enquiry was held , and he ignored the complicity of members of the [[ indian national congress | congress ]] party who took part in the violence . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 10 }} {{ sfn | bihar }} {{ sfn | markovits }} this rioting was in retaliation to the [[ noakhali carnage ]] against hindus which , in turn , was a reaction against the atrocities of [[ direct action day ]] in [[ kolkata | calcutta ]] . {{ sfn | d ' costa | 2010 | p = 213 }} = = = 1983 nellie massacre = = = the 1983 [[ nellie massacre ]] has been described as one the largest and most severe pogroms since the [[ world war ii ]] , with an estimated death toll of 5 , 000 , the majority of which were women and children , as a result of the actions of the [[ assam movement ]] . {{ sfn | ghosh | 2004 | p = 312 }} {{ sfn | hussain | 2009 | p = 261 }} one reason cited for this incident is that it resulted from a build - up of resentment over immigration . {{ sfn | datta | 2012 | p = 183 }} the assam movement insisted on striking the names of [[ illegal immigration | illegal immigrants ]] from the electoral register and their deportation from the state . there was widespread support for the movement , which tapered off between 1981 and 1982 . the movement demanded that anyone who had entered the state illegally since 1951 be deported . the central government , however , insisted on a cutoff date of 1971 . towards the end of 1982 , the central government called elections and the movement called for people to [[ boycott ]] it , which led to the widespread violence . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 418 }} since the incident , no investigation has ever been launched . {{ sfn | saikia | 2011 | pp = 263 – 264 }} the massacre stands as a testament that the [[ all assam students union ]] ( aasu ) had left behind the economic reasons for the protests and the non violent methods they had employed up until then , and that they had become influenced by religious politics . the aasu denied any involvement in the massacre and ensured that there were no further instances of organized violence after the incident at nellie . since , then there have been no instances of communal violence in [[ upper assam division | upper assam ]] . {{ sfn | saikia | 2005 | p = 65 }} = = = 1969 gujarat riots = = = during the [[ 1969 gujarat riots ]] , it is estimated that 630 people lost their lives . {{ sfn | khalidi | 2009 | p = 180 }} in 1980 in moradabad , an estimated 2 , 500 people were killed . the official estimate is 400 and other observers estimate between 1 , 500 and 2 , 000 . local police were directly implicated in planning the violence . {{ sfn | engineer | 1991 | p = 209 }} in 1989 in bhagalpur , it is estimated nearly 1 , 000 people lost their lives in violent attacks , {{ sfn | khalidi | 2009 | p = 180 }} believed to be a result of tensions raised over the [[ ayodhya dispute ]] and the processions carried out by vhp activists , which were to be a show of strength and to serve as a warning to the minority communities . {{ sfn | berglund | 2011 | p = 105 }} = = = 1992 bombay riots = = = the destruction of the [[ babri mosque ]] by [[ hindu nationalism | hindu nationalists ]] led directly to the 1992 [[ bombay riots ]] . {{ sfn | metcalf | 2009 | p = 31 }} bbc correspondent toral varia called the riots " a pre - planned pogrom , " that had been in the making since 1990 , and stated that the destruction of the mosque was " the final provocation " . {{ sfn | varia | 2007 }} writer [[ arundhati roy ]] wrote the essay " fascism ' s firm footprint in india " in ' ' the nation ' ' , arguing that the attack had been a " meticulously planned pogrom " . < ref > arundhati roy . 2002 . fascism ’ s firm footprint in india 30 september 2002 . the nation [ http : / / www . xtome . org / docs / countries / india / ar093002 . pdf ] < / ref > several scholars have likewise concluded that the riots must have been pre - planned , and that hindu rioters had been given access to information about the locations of muslim homes and businesses from non - public sources . < ref > chris ogden . a lasting legacy : the bjp - led national democratic alliance and india ' s politics . journal of contemporary asia . vol . 42 , iss . 1 , 2012 < / ref > this violence is widely reported as having been orchestrated by [[ shiv sena ]] , a nationalist group led by [[ bal thackeray ]] . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 254 }} a high - ranking member of the special branch , v . deshmukh , gave evidence to the commission tasked with probing the riots . he said the failures in intelligence and prevention had been due to political assurances that the [[ mosque ]] in [[ ayodhya ]] would be protected , that the police were fully aware of the shiv sena ' s capabilities to commit acts of violence , and that they had incited hate against the minority communities . {{ sfn | blom hansen | 2001 | p = 137 }} [[ file : ahmedabad riots1 . jpg | thumb | 250px | < center > the skyline of ahmedabad filled with smoke as buildings and shops are set on fire by rioting mobs < / center > . ]] = = = 2002 gujarat violence = = = since partition , there have been several acts of mass violence carried out against muslims in [[ gujarat ]] . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} in [[ 2002 gujarat violence | 2002 ]] , in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror , " {{ sfn | singh | 2009 | p = 248 }} hindu [[ extremism | extremists ]] carried out acts of extreme violence against the muslim minority population . the starting point for the incident was the [[ godhra train burning | attack ]] on a train , which was blamed on muslims . {{ sfn | tilly | 2006 | p = 119 }} during the incident , young girls were [[ rape in india | sexually assaulted ]] , burned or hacked to death . {{ sfn | holst | 2004 | p = 149 }} these rapes were condoned by the ruling bjp , {{ sfn | raman | 2009 | p = 210 }} {{ sfn | gangoli | 2007 | p = 42 }} whose refusal to intervene lead to the displacement of 200 , 000 . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 70 }} death toll figures range from the official estimate of 790 muslims and 254 hindus killed , to 2 , 000 muslims killed . {{ sfn | campbell | 2012 | p = 233 }} chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215 }} according to brass , the only conclusion from the evidence which is available points to a methodical pogrom , which was carried out with exceptional brutality and was highly coordinated . {{ sfn | brass | 2005 | p = 388 }} in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a state - sanctioned pogrom . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }} = = depictions = = the film ' ' [[ parzania ]] ' ' , which is based on the [[ gulbarg society massacre ]] which occurred during the 2002 violence , was boycotted by [[ movie theater | cinemas ]] in gujarat over fear of sparking another riot . the film documents atrocities such as families being burned alive in their homes by hindu extremists , women being set on fire after being gang - raped , and children being hacked to pieces . {{ sfn | chu | 2007 }} ' ' [[ final solution ( 2003 film ) | final solution ]] ' ' by [[ rakesh sharma ]] is considered one of the better [[ documentary film | documentaries ]] which covers the violence in gujarat in 2002 . {{ sfn | gupta | 2013 | p = 372 }} the [[ central board of film certification ]] had tried to [[ censorship in india | ban ]] the film but , in 2004 , chairman [[ anupam kher ]] granted a certificate which allowed an uncut version to be screened . {{ sfn | mazzarella | 2013 | p = 224 }}
750039531 16 huawei 317 - 2034 - 9 | pages = 250 – 251 }} < / ref > = = manifestation = = violence against muslims is frequently in the form of mob attacks on [[ muslim ]] s by [[ hindu ]] s . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 65 | quote = deaths in hindu - muslim riots have three sources : " mob action " , " police killings " and " isolated incidents " . " mob action " may take the form of confrontations between gangs or crowds from different communities or segments of them , armed with sticks , knives , swords , and occasionally bombs and small weapons , and kerosene . it often involves armed gangs from one community seeking out defenseless persons or whole families in their homes , slashing and cutting up the male members and sometimes the female members , and raping the latter , and burning all alive including the children . a second source is police killings , which account for a large number of deaths in several major riots for which figures have been provided by inquiry commission reports , and which cannot be justified in terms of " crowd control " . these killings are disproportionately of muslims . }} {{ sfn | riaz | 2008 | p = 165 | ps = : " violence perpetrated against muslims is now naturalized : riots are ' well - known and accepted transgression of routine political behavior in india . ' . . . ' hindu - muslim riots and anti - muslim pogroms have been endemic in india since independence . ' " }} these attacks are referred to as [[ communal violence | communal riots ]] in india and are seen to be part of a pattern of sporadic [[ sectarian violence ]] between the majority hindu and minority muslim communities , and have also been connected to a rise in [[ islamophobia ]] throughout the 20th century . {{ sfn | herman | 2006 | p = 65 }} most incidents have occurred in the northern and western states of india , whereas communalist sentiment in the south and east is less pronounced . {{ sfn | cohen | 2013 | p = 66 }} among the largest incidents were [[ great calcutta killings ]] in 1946 , [[ noakhali riots # repercussions in bihar | bihar ]] and garmukhteshwar in 1946 after [[ noakhali riot ]] in east bengal , the massacre of muslims in [[ jammu division | jammu ]] in 1947 , large - scale killing of muslims following the [[ operation polo ]] in [[ hyderabad state | hyderabad ]] , anti - muslim riots in kolkata in the aftermath of [[ 1950 barisal riots ]] and [[ 1964 east - pakistan riots ]] , [[ 1969 gujarat riots ]] , [[ 1984 bhiwandi riot ]] , [[ 1985 gujarat riots ]] , [[ 1989 bhagalpur riots ]] , [[ bombay riots ]] , [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] in 1983 {{ sfn | ganguly | 2007 | p = 135 }} and [[ 2002 gujarat violence | gujarat riot ]] in 2002 and [[ 2013 muzaffarnagar riots ]] . these patterns of violence have been well - established since partition , with dozens of studies documenting instances of mass violence against minority groups . {{ sfn | pennington | 2012 | p = 32 }} over 10 , 000 people have been killed in hindu - muslim communal violence since 1950 . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} according to official figures , there were 6 , 933 instances of communal violence between 1954 and 1982 and , between 1968 and 1980 , there were 530 hindus and 1 , 598 muslims killed in a total of 3 , 949 instances of mass violence . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 60 }} in 1989 , there were incidents of mass violence throughout the north of india . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} [[ praveen swami ]] believes these periodic acts of violence have " scarred india ' s post independence history " and have also hindered india ' s cause in [[ jammu and kashmir ]] with regard to the [[ kashmir conflict ]] . {{ sfn | swami | 2006 | p = 217 }} = = causes and effects = = {{ location map + | india | float = right | width = 400 | caption = location of incidents . city name with year | places = {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ 1969 gujarat riots | ahmedabad ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1969 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = topleft | lat = 23 . 03 | long = 72 . 58 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ nellie massacre | nellie ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1983 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = bottom | lat = 26 . 133 | long = 92 . 312 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | bhagalpur ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1989 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = bottom | lat = 25 . 1500 | long = 87 . 0200 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ 1980 moradabad riots | moradabad ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1980 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = farleft | lat = 28 . 83 | long = 78 . 78 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ bombay riots | mumbai ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1992 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = right | lat = 18 . 975 | long = 72 . 825833 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ 2002 gujarat riots | gujarat ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 2002 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = left | lat = 23 | long = 72 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ 1984 bhiwandi riot | bhiwandi ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1984 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = left | lat = 19 . 296 | long = 73 . 063 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ hashimpura massacre | meerut ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1982 , 1987 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = left | lat = 28 . 99 | long = 77 . 70 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ 2013 muzaffarnagar riots | muzaffarnagar ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 2013 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = top | lat = 29 . 47 | long = 77 . 70 | marksize = 6 }} {{ location map ~ | india | label = ' ' ' [[ demolition of the babri masjid | ayodhya ]] ' ' ' < br > ( 1992 ) | mark = location dot red . svg | position = right | lat = 26 . 80 | long = 82 . 20 | marksize = 6 }} }} the roots of this violence lie in india ' s history , stemming from lingering resentment toward the [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | islamic domination ]] of india during the [[ middle ages ]] , policies established by the country ' s [[ british raj | british colonizers ]] , the violent partition of india into a muslim [[ pakistan ]] , and a secular india with a large but minority [[ islam in india | muslim population ]] . {{ sfn | smith | 2005 | pp = 11 – 12 }} {{ undue weight inline | date = may 2014 }} some scholars have described incidents of anti - muslim violence as politically motivated and organized and called them [[ pogrom ]] s {{ sfn | metcalf | 2009 | p = 117 }} or acts of [[ genocide ]] , {{ sfn | holt | 1977 | p = 117 }} {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 126 }} or a form of [[ state terrorism ]] with " organized political massacres " {{ sfn | pandey | 2005 | p = 188 }} rather than mere " [[ riot ]] s " . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} others argue that , although their community faces discrimination and violence , some muslims have been highly successful , {{ sfn | metcalf | 2013 | p = 109 }} that the violence is not as widespread as it appears , but is restricted to certain urban areas because of local socio - political conditions , and there are many cities where muslims and hindus live peacefully together with almost no incidences of sectarian violence . {{ sfn | varshney }} in anti - muslim riots in india there are three muslims killed for one hindu . < ref > [ http : / / www . sabhlokcity . com / 2014 / 10 / for - every - hindu - killed - in - communal - religious - violence - three - muslims - have - been - killed - in - independent - india - statistics - re - riots / for every hindu killed in communal religious violence , three muslims have been killed in independent india . ( statistics re : riots ) ] < / ref > the economic competition between hindus and muslims also results in planned riots where muslim businesses are specifically targeted . < ref > [ http : / / www . yale . edu / macmillan / ocvprogram / licep / 3 / wilkinson / wilkinson . pdf religious politics and communal violence : critical issues in indian politics ] < / ref > = = = role of political parties = = = many social scientists feel that many of these acts of violence are institutionally supported , particularly by political parties and organizations connected to the [[ hindu nationalism | hindu nationalist ]] volunteer organisation , [[ rashtriya swayamsevak sangh ]] ( rss ) . in particular , scholars fault the [[ bharatiya janata party ]] ( bjp ) and the [[ shiv sena ]] for complicity in these incidents of violence {{ sfn | brass | a }} {{ sfn | brass | b }} {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} {{ sfn | sarkur | 2007 | p = 187 }} {{ sfn | brekke | 2012 | pp = 86 – 87 }} and of using violence against muslims as a part of a larger electoral strategy . {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 376 }} {{ sfn | jaffrelot | 2011 | p = 382 }} for example , research by raheel dhattiwala and michael biggs has stated that killings are far higher in areas where the bjp faces stiff electoral opposition than in areas in which it is already strong . {{ sfn | dhattiwala | 2012 | pp = 483 – 516 }} in 1989 , the north of india saw an increase in orchestrated attacks on muslims , and the bjp had further success in the local and state elections . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} the [[ social anthropologist ]] [[ stanley jeyaraja tambiah ]] concludes that the violence in [[ bhagalpur ]] in [[ 1989 bhagalpur violence | 1989 ]] , hashimpura in [[ hashimpura massacre | 1987 ]] and in [[ moradabad ]] [[ 1980 moradabad riots | 1980 ]] were organised killings . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 321 }} according to [[ ram puniyani ]] , the shiv sena were victorious in the elections due to the violence in the 1990s , and the bjp in gujarat after the 2002 violence . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} [[ gyan prakash ]] , however , cautions that the bjp ' s actions in gujarat do not equate to the entirety of india , and it remains to be seen if the [[ hindutva ]] movement has been successful in the deployment of this strategy nationwide . {{ sfn | prakash | 2007 | pp = 177 – 179 }} = = = economic and cultural factors = = = hindu nationalists use the historical [[ muslim conquest in the indian subcontinent | subjugation ]] of india by muslims as an excuse for violence . their view is that these conquerors had raped hindu women and destroyed places of worship . they feel that , since the partition , indian muslims are [[ pro - pakistan sentiment | allied to pakistan ]] and are possible terrorists and , therefore , the hindus must take revenge for these past wrongs and reassert their pride . {{ original research inline | date = august 2015 }} {{ sfn | etzion | 2008 | pp = 123 – 124 }} the higher fertility rate among muslims has been a recurring theme in the hindu right ' s rhetoric . they claim that the [[ islam in india # population growth rate | higher ]] birth rate among muslims is part of a plan to turn the hindus into a minority within their own country . {{ original research inline | date = august 2015 }} {{ sfn | weigl | 2012 | p = 19 }} another reason given for these outbreaks of violence is the upward mobility of the [[ caste system in india | lower castes ]] caused by the expansion of the economy . the violence has become a substitute for class tensions . nationalists , rather than deal with the claims from the lower class , instead view muslims and christians as not " fully indian " due to their religion , {{ sfn | metcalf | 2006 | p = 89 }} and portray those who carry out these attacks as " heroes " that defended the majority from " anti - nationals " . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | pp = 12 – 13 }} muslims are viewed as suspect and their loyalty to the state is questioned because of the ill - will still prevalent after the violence during [[ partition of india | partition ]] . according to [[ omar khalidi ]] : < blockquote > anti - muslim violence is planned and executed to render muslims economically and socially crippled and , as a final outcome of that economic and social backwardness , assimilating them into lower rungs of hindu society . {{ sfn | puniyan | 2003 | p = 153 }} < / blockquote > [[ cultural nationalism ]] has also been given as a reason for instances of violence carried out by [[ shiv sena ]] which initially claimed to speak for the people of [[ maharashtra ]] , but quickly turned their [[ rhetoric ]] to inciting violence against muslims . the shiv sena were complicit in the violence in 1984 in the town of [[ bhiwandi ]] , and again in the violence in [[ mumbai | bombay ]] in 1992 and 1993 . {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 29 }} in both of these instances , sena had help from the police and local officials . {{ citation needed | date = august 2015 }} violence has been incited by sena in 1971 and 1986 . {{ sfn | kaur | 2005 | p = 160 }} {{ sfn | chandavarkar | 2009 | p = 114 }} according to [[ sudipta kaviraj ]] , the [[ vishva hindu parishad ]] ( vhp ) are still engaged in the religious conflicts which began in the medieval times . {{ sfn | kaviraj | 2010 | p = 245 }} anti - muslim violence creates a security risk for hindus residing outside of india . since the 1950s , there have been retaliatory attacks on hindus in pakistan and [[ bangladesh ]] in response to anti - muslim violence in india . after the 1992 violence in bombay , hindu temples were attacked in [[ great britain | britain ]] , [[ dubai ]] and [[ thailand ]] . {{ sfn | wilkinson | 2006 | p = 16 }} this recurring violence has become a rigidly conventional pattern which has created a divide between the muslim and hindu communities . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 187 }} [[ jamaat - e - islami hind ]] has spoken out against these communal clashes , as it believes that the violence not only impacts upon muslims , but india as a whole , and that these riots are damaging to india ' s progress . {{ sfn | sikand | 2004 | p = 86 }} in gujarat , the [[ terrorist and disruptive activities ( prevention ) act ]] ( tada ) was used in incidents pertaining to communal violence in 1992 and 1993 . the majority of those arrested under the act were muslim . conversely , tada was not used after the violence carried out against muslims during the [[ bombay riots ]] . {{ sfn | singh | 2012 | p = 427 }} = = = demographics = = = the bjp politicians , as well as those of other parties , argue that [[ demographics ]] play an essential role in indian elections . the bjp believe that the higher the number of muslims within a constituency , the higher are the chances of centrist parties to acquiesce to minority groups ' requests , which lowers the chances of muslims " building bridges " with their hindu neighbours . as such , according to this argument " muslim appeasement " is the root cause of communal violence . {{ sfn | varshney | 2003 | p = 8 }} susanne and lloyd rudolph argue that the economic disparity is a reason for the aggression shown towards muslims by hindus . as india ' s economy expanded due to [[ globalization ]] and [[ investment ]] from overseas companies , the expectations of the hindu population were not matched by the opportunities . hindu nationalists then encouraged the perception of muslims as the source of the hindus ' troubles . {{ sfn | price | 2012 | p = 95 }} the actions of anti - hindu and [[ insurgency in jammu and kashmir | anti - india militant groups ]] in [[ kashmir conflict | kashmir ]] and pakistan have reinforced anti - muslim feelings in india , which has strengthened the hindu right . the [[ hindutva ]] discourse portrays muslims as traitors and state enemies , whose patriotism is suspected . {{ sfn | sikand | 2006 | p = 88 }} [[ sumit ganguly ]] argues that the rise in terrorism cannot only be attributed to [[ socioeconomics | socioeconomic ]] factors , but also to the violence perpetrated by hindutva forces . {{ sfn | ganguly | 2003 | p = 10 }} = = major incidents = = = = = 1964 kolkata = = = riots between [[ hindu ]] s and [[ muslim ]] s had left over a hundred people dead , 438 people were injured . over 7000 people were arrested . 70000 muslims have fled their homes and 55000 were provided protection by the [[ indian army ]] . muslims in kolkata became more ghettoized than ever before in the aftermath of this riot . the riot was believed to be instigated by violence against hindus in [[ east pakistan ]] ( now bangladesh ) and the flow of refugees from there . violence was also seen in rural [[ west bengal ]] . < ref > {{ cite web | title = 1964 : riots in calcutta leave more than 100 dead | url = http : / / news . bbc . co . uk / onthisday / hi / dates / stories / january / 13 / newsid _ 4098000 / 4098363 . stm | website = news . bbc . co . uk | publisher = british broadcasting corporation | accessdate = 7 july 2015 }} < / ref > = = = 1983 nellie massacre = = = in the state of [[ assam ]] in 1983 the [[ nellie massacre ]] occurred . nearly 1 , 800 muslims of bengali origin were slaughtered by lalung tribespeople ( also known as tiwa ) at a village called nellie . {{ sfn | hazarika | 1984 }} {{ sfn | s . b . | 2012 }} it has been described as one of the most severe massacre since [[ world war ii ]] with the majority of victims being women and children , as a result of the actions of the [[ assam movement ]] . {{ sfn | ghosh | 2004 | p = 312 }} {{ sfn | hussain | 2009 | p = 261 }} one reason cited for this incident is that it resulted from a build - up of resentment over immigration . {{ sfn | datta | 2012 | p = 183 }} the assam movement insisted on striking the names of [[ illegal immigration | illegal immigrants ]] from the electoral register and their deportation from the state . there was widespread support for the movement , which tapered off between 1981 and 1982 . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 481 }} the movement demanded that anyone who had entered the state illegally since 1951 be deported . the central government , however , insisted on a cutoff date of 1971 . towards the end of 1982 , the central government called elections and the movement called for people to [[ boycott ]] it , which led to the widespread violence . {{ sfn | chatterji | 2013 | p = 418 }} the official tiwari commission report on the nellie massacre is still a closely guarded secret ( only three copies exist ) . < ref name = " at " > {{ cite web | url = http : / / www . assamtribune . com / scripts / details . asp ? id = feb1908 / at02 | title = 83 polls were a mistake : kps gill | publisher = assam tribune | date = 18 february 2008 | accessdate = 2 august 2012 }} < / ref > the 600 - page report was submitted to the assam government in 1984 and the congress government ( headed by [[ hiteswar saikia ]] ) decided not to make it public , and subsequent governments followed suit . < ref name = " tehelka " > {{ cite web | url = http : / / www . tehelka . com / story _ main19 . asp ? filename = ne093006the _ horrors . asp | title = an untold shame | last = rehman | first = teresa | publisher = tehelka magazine | accessdate = 2011 - 12 - 08 }} < / ref > [[ assam united democratic front ]] and others are making legal efforts to make tiwari commission report public , so that reasonable justice is delivered to victims , at least after 25 years after the incident . < ref > {{ cite news | last = reporter | first = staff | title = flashback to nellie horror : audf to move court for probe report | newspaper = the telegraph | date = 19 february 2008 | url = http : / / www . telegraphindia . com / 1080219 / jsp / guwahati / story _ 8920369 . jsp | accessdate = 10 october 2012 }} < / ref > since , then there have been no instances of communal violence in [[ upper assam division | upper assam ]] . {{ sfn | saikia | 2005 | p = 65 }} = = = 1969 to 1989 = = = during the [[ 1969 gujarat riots ]] , it is estimated that 630 people lost their lives . {{ sfn | khalidi | 2009 | p = 180 }} the [[ 1970 bhiwandi riots ]] was an instance of anti - muslim violence which occurred between 7 and 8 may in the indian towns of bhiwandi , jalgaon and mahad . there were large amounts of arson and vandalism of muslim - owned properties . in 1980 in moradabad , an estimated 2 , 500 people were killed . the official estimate is 400 and other observers estimate between 1 , 500 and 2 , 000 . local police were directly implicated in planning the violence . {{ sfn | engineer | 1991 | p = 209 }} in 1989 in bhagalpur , it is estimated nearly 1 , 000 people lost their lives in violent attacks , {{ sfn | khalidi | 2009 | p = 180 }} believed to be a result of tensions raised over the [[ ayodhya dispute ]] and the processions carried out by vhp activists , which were to be a show of strength and to serve as a warning to the minority communities . {{ sfn | berglund | 2011 | p = 105 }} = = = 1987 hashimpura massacre = = = [[ hashimpura massacre ]] happened on 22 may 1987 , during the [[ 1987 meerut riots | hindu - muslim riots ]] in [[ meerut ]] city in [[ uttar pradesh ]] state , india , when 19 personnel of the [[ uttar pradesh provincial armed constabulary | provincial armed constabulary ]] ( pac ) allegedly rounded up 42 muslim youth from the hashimpura ' ' [[ mohalla ]] ' ' ( locality ) of the city , took them in truck to the outskirts , near [[ murad nagar ]] , in [[ ghaziabad district , india | ghaziabad district ]] , where they were shot and their bodies were [[ dump job # police usage | dump ]] ed in water canals . a few days later dead bodies were found floating in the canals . in may 2000 , 16 of the 19 accused surrendered , and were later released on bail , while 3 were already dead . the trial of the case was transferred by the [[ supreme court of india ]] in 2002 from [[ ghaziabad , india | ghaziabad ]] to a [[ sessions court ]] at the [[ tis hazari court | tis hazari ]] complex in [[ delhi ]] , < ref name = ft > {{ cite news | title = justice out of sight | url = http : / / www . hinduonnet . com / fline / fl2210 / stories / 20050520001504300 . htm | publisher = [[ frontline ( magazine ) ]] | volume = 22 | issue = 10 | date = may 2008 | pages = 7 – 20 }} < / ref > < ref name = tt > {{ cite news | title = hashimpura massacre : rifles given to pac | url = http : / / articles . timesofindia . indiatimes . com / 2006 - 07 - 27 / india / 27806339 _ 1 _ rifles - case - property - hashimpura - massacre | work = the times india | date = 27 jul 2006 }} < / ref > where it is the oldest pending case . < ref name = exp > {{ cite news | title = 20 years delayed , trial put off again | url = http : / / cities . expressindia . com / local - news / archivefullstory . php ? newsid = 193052 & creation _ date = 2006 - 07 - 16 | work = the indian express | date = 16 july 2006 | quote = “this is the oldest case pending in delhi and yet the prosecuting agency is still slow . . " – asj kaushik , july 22 , 2007 . }} < / ref > = = = 1992 bombay riots = = = the destruction of the [[ babri mosque ]] by [[ hindu nationalism | hindu nationalists ]] led directly to the 1992 [[ bombay riots ]] . {{ sfn | metcalf | 2009 | p = 31 }} bbc correspondent toral varia called the riots " a pre - planned pogrom , " that had been in the making since 1990 , and stated that the destruction of the mosque was " the final provocation " . {{ sfn | varia | 2007 }} several scholars have likewise concluded that the riots must have been pre - planned , and that hindu rioters had been given access to information about the locations of muslim homes and businesses from non - public sources . < ref > chris ogden . a lasting legacy : the bjp - led national democratic alliance and india ' s politics . journal of contemporary asia . vol . 42 , iss . 1 , 2012 < / ref > this violence is widely reported as having been orchestrated by [[ shiv sena ]] , a hindu nationalist group led by [[ bal thackeray ]] . {{ sfn | tambiah | 1997 | p = 254 }} a high - ranking member of the special branch , v . deshmukh , gave evidence to the commission tasked with probing the riots . he said the failures in intelligence and prevention had been due to political assurances that the [[ mosque ]] in [[ ayodhya ]] would be protected , that the police were fully aware of the shiv sena ' s capabilities to commit acts of violence , and that they had incited hate against the minority communities . {{ sfn | blom hansen | 2001 | p = 137 }} [[ file : ahmedabad riots1 . jpg | thumb | 250px | < center > the skyline of ahmedabad filled with smoke as buildings and shops are set on fire by rioting mobs < / center > ]] = = = 2002 gujarat violence = = = {{ main article | 2002 gujarat violence }} since partition , muslim community has been subject to and engaged in sectarian violence in [[ gujarat ]] . {{ sfn | ghassem - fachandi | 2012 | p = 2 }} in [[ 2002 gujarat violence | 2002 ]] , in an incident described as an act of " fascistic state terror , " {{ sfn | singh | 2010 | p = 348 }} hindu [[ extremism | extremists ]] carried out acts of violence against the muslim minority population , in retaliation to on going sectarian violence and persecution by radicalised islamists , often backed by the pakistan intelligence services , with increasing support amongst the local muslim population . < ref > {{ cite news | url = http : / / www . theguardian . com / cities / 2014 / nov / 26 / india - terror - threat - mumbai - attacks | title = terror threat to india rising again six years after mumbai attacks | last = burke | first = jason | date = 2014 - 11 - 25 | newspaper = the guardian | language = en - gb | issn = 0261 - 3077 | access - date = 2016 - 04 - 19 }} < / ref > the starting point for the incident was the [[ godhra train burning ]] which was allegedly done by muslims . {{ sfn | tilly | 2006 | p = 119 }} during the incident , young girls were [[ rape in india | sexually assaulted ]] , burned or hacked to death . {{ sfn | holst | 2004 | p = 149 }} these rapes were condoned by the ruling bjp , {{ sfn | raman | 2009 | p = 210 }} {{ sfn | gangoli | 2007 | p = 42 }} whose refusal to intervene lead to the displacement of 200 , 000 . {{ sfn | shani | 2007 | p = 70 }} death toll figures range from the official estimate of 790 muslims and 254 hindus killed , to 2 , 000 muslims killed . {{ sfn | campbell | 2012 | p = 233 }} then chief minister [[ narendra modi ]] has also been accused of initiating and condoning the violence , as have the police and government officials who took part , as they directed the rioters and gave lists of muslim - owned properties to the extremists . {{ sfn | murphy | 2011 | p = 86 }} [[ mallika sarabhai ]] , who had complained over state complicity in the violence , was harassed , intimidated and falsely accused of [[ human trafficking ]] by the bjp . {{ sfn | vickery | 2010 | p = 455 }} three police officers were given punitive transfers by the bjp after they had successfully put down the rioting in their wards , so as not to interfere further in preventing the violence . {{ sfn | eckhert | 2005 | p = 215 }} according to brass , the only conclusion from the evidence which is available points to a methodical pogrom , which was carried out with " exceptional brutality and was highly coordinated " . {{ sfn | brass | 2003 | p = 388 }} in 2007 , ' ' [[ tehelka ]] ' ' magazine released " [[ the truth : gujarat 2002 ]] , " a report which implicated the state government in the violence , and claimed that what had been called a spontaneous act of revenge was , in reality , a " state - sanctioned pogrom " . {{ sfn | risam | 2010 | p = 521 }} according to [[ human rights watch ]] , the violence in gujarat in 2002 was pre - planned , and the police and state government participated in the violence . {{ sfn | narula | 2002 }} in 2012 , modi was cleared of complicity in the violence by a special investigation team appointed by the supreme court . the muslim community is reported to have reacted with " anger and disbelief , " and activist [[ teesta setalvad ]] has said the legal fight was not yet over , as they had the right to appeal . {{ sfn | krishnan | 2012 }} human rights watch has reported on acts of exceptional heroism by hindus , [[ dalit ]] s and tribals , who tried to protect muslims from the violence . {{ sfn | human rights watch | 2003 }} = = depictions = = the film ' ' [[ parzania ]] ' ' , which is based on the [[ gulbarg society massacre ]] which occurred during the 2002 violence , was boycotted by [[ movie theater | cinemas ]] in gujarat over fear of sparking another riot . the film documents atrocities such as families being burned alive in their homes by hindu extremists , women being set on fire after being gang - raped , and children being hacked to pieces . {{ sfn | chu | 2007 }} ' ' [[ final solution ( 2003 film ) | final solution ]] ' ' by [[ rakesh sharma ( filmmaker ) | rakesh sharma ]] is considered one of the better [[ documentary film | documentaries ]] which covers the violence in gujarat in 2002 . {{ sfn | gupta | 2013 | p = 372 }} the [[ central board of film certification ]] had tried to [[ censorship in india | ban ]] the film but , in 2004 , chairman [[ anupam kher ]] granted a certificate which allowed an uncut version to be screened . {{ sfn | mazzarella | 2013 | p = 224 }} = = see also = = * [[ terrorism in india ]] * [[ religious violence in india ]] * [[ persecution of muslims ]] * [[ persecution of hindus ]] * [[ islam in india ]] = = references = = {{ reflist | 30em }}
